title: General Kitchen Helper
description:
Job Purpose

The General Helper actively participates in the daily operation of the camp catering unit.

Duties and Responsibilities

· The basic preparation of food and beverages including the preparation of vegetables and snacks.

· Simple cooking including the reconstitution of prepared food.

· General kitchen and dining room duties including washing up, setting up and clearing away equipment and tables, cleaning of the kitchen and dining room surrounds and, equipment to include all work surfaces, dining furniture, floors and walls.

  • Sweep and scrub floors.
  • Remove garbage.
  • Clean kitchen equipment.
  • Scrape food from plates and wash food trays.
  • Wash dishes as required.
  • Clean flatware, and wash pots and pans.
  • Assist in receiving and storing supplies.
  • Stock cupboards, refrigerators and salad bars.
  • Assist in basic food preparation.
  • Prepare ingredients (for example, wash and slice vegetables).
  • Package take-out foods.
  • Perform other duties as directed by the Chef.

Qualifications

· Food Safe Certification.

· Experience working in a kitchen setting.

  • Experience working a rotational schedule in a seasonal remote camp environment.

· Excellent communication skills.

Working Conditions

The special working conditions entails work dependent on the industry and weather, 12 hour day and/or night shift work, 3 weeks in and 1 week out rotational schedule, and being isolated for periods of time.

Physical Requirement

General Helper position requires standing for extended periods of time, lifting and carrying heavy objects (50+ pounds) on a regular basis, and performing repetitive tasks with few breaks.

Safety Responsibility

Attend and participate in daily Toolbox Meetings and weekly Safety Meetings.

Report all incidents, near misses, injuries and property damage incidents to the supervisor immediately.

Perform Fire Warden duties, as required.

Job Types: Full-time, Seasonal

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $15.00-$17.00 per hour

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $15.00-$17.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Extended health care

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift
  • Overtime

COVID-19 considerations:
All employees will take a Rapid Test every 3 days and be masked in high traffic areas. Candidates will be required to be fully vaccinated to be considered for the position.

Application question(s):

  • When would you be available to start working?

Work remotely:

  • No

title: Camp Attendant
description:
Job Purpose

The Seasonal Camp Attendant is responsible for ensuring the living area of the camp is clean and sanitary. They will consistently provide positive service and assistance with all camp employees and guests while making sure to follow all policies and guidelines as set out by Health and Safety Guidelines.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Keep the living areas of the camp in a clean and sanitary manner (sleeping quarters, hallways, washrooms, and entrance ways).
  • Vacuum and sweep daily.
  • Empty garbage cans in all rooms daily
  • Wash all towels, aprons, etc. as required in the a.m. or early p.m. to leave machines free for the crews to do their laundry.
  • Clean lint screens in the dryer after every load.
  • Make beds daily and change linen weekly or as required.
  • Keep an accurate record of housekeeping supplies and store in a secure place to discourage loss.
  • Keep sidewalks and walkways clean of debris, snow and ice.
  • Clean the inside of windows weekly and wash down the outside windows of the camps as required.
  • Ensure no leaks or garbage is around the camps and that the shutters on the outside of the camp are open (not closed).
  • Follow all guidelines as set out by the HACCP (Hazard Analysis Critical Control Points).
  • Camp Attendant’s duties are not limited to the job description as each client may have different requirements.

Qualifications

  • Previous experience cleaning in camps is considered an asset.
  • 2+ years’ experience working a rotational schedule in a seasonal remote camp environment.
  • Excellent attention to detail with an ability to work independently and in a team environment.

Working Conditions

The special working conditions entails seasonal work dependent on the industry and weather, 12 hour shift work, 3 weeks in and 1 week out rotational schedule, and being isolated for periods of time.

Physical Requirements

Seasonal Camp Attendant position requires standing for extended periods of time, lifting and carrying heavy objects (50+ pounds) on a regular basis, and performing repetitive tasks with few breaks.

Safety Responsibility

Attend and participate in daily Toolbox Meetings and weekly Safety Meetings

Report all incidents, near misses, injuries and property damage incidents to the supervisor immediately

Perform Fire Warden duties, as required

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $15.00-$16.00 per hour

COVID-19 considerations:
All employees will take a Rapid Test every 3 days and be masked in high traffic areas. Candidates will be required to be fully vaccinated to be considered for the position.

Application question(s):

  • When would you be available to start working?

title: Operations Coordinator (Parks Worker)
description:
Parks West Enterprise Inc. is responsible for managing the Buntzen Lake Recreation Area. Our team prides itself in maintaining a safe, clean, family-oriented recreation area.

The Operations Coordinator (OC) works alongside the Operations Manager and Maintenance Manager in managing operations at the Buntzen Lake Recreation Area.

The OC is responsible for deploying staff, directing operations, and acting as Incident Commander during emergencies. They are hard-working leaders, ensuring all staff are well-informed, organized and working safely.

They help develop and implement new staff policies, procedures and training. They have a detailed understanding of all aspects of park operations and are assigned projects to complete.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Upholding the Core Values of Parks West Enterprise Inc. (see parkswest.ca) and holding staff to these values
  • Acting as the delegate for the Warden &/or Assistant warden when they are not present
  • Ensuring that the public are safe, that they are following recreation area rules, and that staff are working towards this objective
  • Managing staff – ensure staff are safe, motivated and productive
  • Leading emergency response as Incident Commander
  • Providing workplace first aid in the event of staff injuries
  • Organizing park maintenance tasks to specified standards, such as vegetation management, painting, cleaning, etc. and assisting in park maintenance
  • Ensuring daily routines including correct opening &/or closing procedures are followed
  • Recognizing & addressing safety hazards
  • Contributing to daily safety meetings.
  • Responding to changing conditions, such as weather, traffic, wildlife activity, etc.
  • Performing inspections of infrastructure and grounds (i.e. beaches, bridges)
  • Hiring new staff through job postings, interviews, etc.
  • Training staff and developing training programs
  • Conducting performance reviews and administering disciplinary policies
  • Planning and execution of special projects (e.g. Signage plans, Emergency procedures)
  • Managing the office, keeping it tidy, answering the phone, receiving outside agencies, etc.
  • Responding to emails, creating and managing detailed electronic documents. Keeping well organized records and files.
  • Comprehensively understanding and implementing rules, safety policies, operational protocol, etc.

APPLICANT REQUIREMENTS

  • Minimum 2 years of supervisor, management or leadership experience in a park environment
  • Mature, professional attitude, ability to take detailed instructions and receive extensive training
  • Positive leadership skills, able to confidently direct and lead by example. Team-based, non-prejudice and respectful approach
  • Able to remain calm and focused in potentially stressful situations
  • Able to seek help / delegate when appropriate
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Detail-oriented, able to understand and apply company policies, safety protocol, best work practices, etc. Able to produce detailed and clear reports, inspections and other documents.
  • Able to work outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Self-motivated and able to keep others on task
  • Good physical fitness; can walk or stand for prolonged periods of time and lift heavy objects, able to hike for hours in mountainous terrain on occasion
  • Available to work 8 hour shifts between 7am - 10pm and work over-time in emergency situations (shifts finish earlier in the winter).
  • Capable of swimming to safety in unlikely event of water immersion
  • Minimum Occupational First Aid Level 1
  • Valid class 5 BC Driver’s license with clean drivers abstract
  • A PCOC must be acquired if hired
  • WHMIS qualification is required if hired
  • Steel toed boots are required if hired

Additional training will be provided to successful candidates

PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO APPLICANTS WHO ARE / HAVE...

  • Qualified or experienced in first aid / emergency response / incident command (particularly OFA and ICS)
  • Knowledge / experience in workplace safety (practices, legislation, implementation, etc.)
  • Experienced in enforcement, conflict resolution or violence prevention
  • Fire suppression experience, including S-100 qualification or above
  • Experienced in landscaping and/or vegetation maintenance**
  • Previously been employed to drive a vehicle or have driven trucks / large vehicles
  • Previously worked / volunteered driving a boat or otherwise have relevant boating experience
  • Mechanical, construction or repair experience
  • Experienced in customer service / working with the public
  • Experienced in word processing, spreadsheet and/or graphics software

SCHEDULE

**This is a full-time, permanent position

5 x 8 hour shifts/week with 2 consecutive days off

Applicants must be available to work weekends

Work Remotely

  • No

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $27.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Every Weekend
  • Holidays
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, strict safety procedures are in place to reduce the risk of transmission within the workplace. Staff are provided with masks, gloves and training on cleaning procedures to effectively disinfect touched surfaces.

Experience:

  • parks worker: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Class 5 License (required)

Shift availability:

  • Day Shift (required)
  • Night Shift (preferred)

title: Senior Infrastructure Support Analyst
description:
Requisition ID: 139976

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.


The team:

Scotiabank’s Global Technology Services (GTS) - Data Centre Network Services team is responsible for level 3 support & project deployments, both on premise Data Centres and the Cloud, to support the digital transformation of the Bank’s global network. We are responsible for supporting and deploying new technologies, following best practices, and consulting and coordinating with the Bank’s many technology teams with the aim of providing a highly resilient network as the underlying core of the Bank’s technology infrastructure. As part of the larger Global Network Services team, there is involvement in end-to-end network connectivity and solutioning for data centre network services, campus and remote office integrations as well as perimeter security network technologies.


The role:

We are filling multiple positions at our Scarborough IT Campus.


You will play a critical part in helping the team support the various technologies within our Global Network.


You will be expected to be a part of the teams’ rotational on-call duties and, when required, be a part of after-hours project deployments in the evenings or weekends.


Is this role right for you?

  • You are eager to work with leading edge technologies to incorporate complex network solutions, as well as work with other technology teams to contribute to an overall solution.
  • You thrive on being hands-on during mid to complex project deployments into production. This will include the support of assigned systems by acting as an internal consultant on assigned infrastructure and providing suggestions for viable solutions to systems problems of high complexity.
  • You want to be challenged with complex problem solving in time sensitive situations to reduce system downtime and customer impact.
  • You understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
  • You are highly interested in software-defined Data Centre technologies like Cisco ACI and VMWare NSX and want to help drive the road-map and adoption within a large-scale enterprise network.
  • You are interested in getting in on the Cloud floor as the team gets more hands on with the network in the Public Cloud, including environments like Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Microsoft Azure and IBM SoftLayer.


Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role?

  • You have strong communication (verbal/written) and good interpersonal skills to build relationships with internal and external business partners and vendors.
  • You have at least 8+ years of progressive hands-on technical working experience, which includes designing, deploying & supporting various network technologies at an enterprise scale.
  • You have at least 5+ years of hands-on technical working experience with Cisco Routers & Switches like:
  • Cisco® Nexus N9K/N7K/N5K/N2K Solutions
  • Cisco® Integrated Services Routers (ISR) & Aggregation Services Routers (ASR)
  • Cisco® Catalyst N9K
  • You have at least 5+ years of hands-on technical working experience with Cisco® Security/VPN.
  • You have at least 3+ years of hands-on technical working experience with firewall technologies like Fortigate/Cisco® Firepower Threat Defense (FTD).
  • You have at least 5+ years of hands-on technical working experience with F5® BIG-IP® Local Traffic Manager™ (LTM) / Global Traffic Manager™ (GTM).
  • You have at least 5+ years of hands-on technical working experience with Infoblox NIOS products, such as: DDI - DNS, DHCP & IP Address Management (IPAM).
  • You have at least 2 years of hands-on technical working experience with software-defined networking (SDN) technologies like Cisco® Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI™), VMware NSX® or similar.
  • You can demonstrate hands-on technical working experience in managing Public Cloud (Microsoft Azure & Google Cloud Platform preferred) environments, in a network related capacity.
  • You have hands-on technical working experience with Wired and Wireless 802.1x Network Authentication using Cisco® Identity Services Engine (ISE).
  • You have hands-on technical working experience with network automation scripting from Python, REST API endpoint.
  • You possess superior problem solving and decision-making skills to resolve work issues with the ability to work under pressure in a dynamic environment.
  • Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Engineering, Networking Technology or in a related field.


What's in it for you?

  • You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world.
  • We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success! We also foster an environment of innovation and continuous learning.
  • We care about our people, allowing them to design how they work to deliver amazing results.
  • We offer a competitive total rewards package, including a performance bonus, company matching programs (pension & Employee Share Ownership), generous vacation; health/medical/wellness benefits; employee banking privileges.
  • While we currently work remotely from home, when required to be onsite, our primary office in Scarborough is:
  • Renovated with a design focus on enabling collaboration through both environment and technology.
  • Furnished with an onsite cafeteria that serves hot foods, salads, sandwiches & snacks.
  • Equipped for breaks with table tennis, table soccer, pool table & TV’s. Our lounges have fridges, microwaves, complimentary hot beverage stations & water dispensers.
  • Minutes by TTC bus from Warden subway station on Line 2. Free employee shuttle service connecting the IT campus with nearby GO stations. 2023 opening of the Eglinton Crosstown Light Rail Transit with the Birchmount stop that’s steps away.
  • Minutes from the 401 & DVP. Free onsite & offsite employee parking with charging stations for electric vehicles onsite.


Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Scarborough

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Assistant Front Store Manager LG FRMT
description:
Location:

8601 Warden Avenue, Markham, Ontario, L3R 0B5

Join a locally owned and operated store to help deliver health, beauty and convenience services in your community, and keep the customer at the centre of everything you do.



Why this role is important?

SUMMARY:

To assist the Front Store Manager (FSM) in managing the human, physical and financial resources of the store and in ensuring that store objectives are achieved by focusing on improving product flow from the backroom to the sales floor.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Operations

  • Role models best practice customer service at Shoppers Drug Mart
  • Supports Loss Prevention processes related to cash management and Front Store processes to minimize risk
  • Participates in hiring/onboarding of new cashiers
  • Ensures all Cash staff have completed cash training and customer service training through SDMU
  • Identifies and trains Supervisors from existing cashiers where possible
  • Follows up with Supervisors to ensure communication cascade for evening /weekend huddles and timely updates as required
  • Update Process Board with tasks from store walk
  • Ensures tasks get accomplished in a timely fashion
  • Ensures that backroom inventory management initiative (BIMI) is to standard at all times
  • Generates daily low stock report and provides to merchandisers/section captains
  • Communicates expected deliveries with receiver to develop an action plan for receiving
  • Role models and monitors adherence to receiving principles focusing on totes first and sorting techniques

Customer Service

  • Proactively engages customers with increased focus during peak traffic times
  • Assists FSM to ensure all product-related processes are implemented effectively
  • Highlights new products, reinforces with staff the need to share upcoming events with customers, recognizes CSI performers during Daily Huddle / Shift
  • Coaches and trains all new merchandising hires on Store Standards
  • Ensures that exceptional customer service is provided beyond expectation, as outlined in the Store Operating Standards
  • Ensures employees present proper image to the public in accordance with Uniform Policy and Dress Code Guidelines (i.e. clean appearance, approved uniform, name badge)
  • Answers inquiries (ie. location of product, rainchecks) and resolves customer complaints according to guidelines
  • Demonstrates product knowledge and familiarity with location of products throughout the store
  • Empowers employees to ensure customer satisfaction

Marketing and Merchandising

  • Oversees implementation of store marketing programs
  • Spotlights new or exclusive products at daily huddles
  • Ensures staff know about upcoming events to share with customers
  • Recognizes CSI performers
  • Oversees PC Optimum program including communication of performance and review and follows up of individual operator ID performance for sign-ups and email captures
  • Assists the FSM in adherence to all marketing programs and initiatives, which may include: 1) Retail price management 2) Planograms, core programs, and merchandising techniques 3) Flyer implementation and local advertising initiatives
  • Creates and maintains proper displays to reflect seasonal and promotional programs
  • Ensures value events are set-up and taken down according to schedule
  • Works with FSM to ensure signage in the store reflects current programs, policies, and procedures
  • Responsible for replenishment orders in absence of FSM

Human Resources

  • Assists in the hiring process for Front End Cashiers/Supervisors (recommend to FSM)
  • Ensures staff is properly trained in all aspects of their role and provides on-going coaching and instructions
  • Assists in ongoing employee performance management and development, including performance reviews, progressive discipline with FSM
  • Complies with employment legislation
  • Ensures employees comply with all policies and procedures

Finance

  • Assists in achieving projected sales growth targets
  • Assists in effective expense management

General

  • Complies with all health and safety regulations
  • Complies with all store policies and procedures
  • Complies with loss prevention policies and procedures and ensures they are executed in the department
  • Ensures Store Standards are followed
  • Maintains confidentiality in all matters pertaining to Shoppers Drug Mart franchised business and its operation
  • Perform other duties as assigned

Management/Supervision/Leadership

  • Provides support to all non Rx parties within the local store
  • Provides direction under the guidance of FSM

QUALIFICATIONS

Planning, Judgement and Decision Making

  • Independent thinking and decision making – Makes decisions when dealing with issues or problems that occur when the FSM is not available. Consultation with the FSM for significant changes.
  • Ability to plan, coordinate and delegate assignments as well as the ability to provide coaching to employees
  • Planning and preparation for Inventory management
  • Monitor service levels on SKUs to control inventory
  • Identify overstock and develop a clearance strategy
  • Identify and recognize superior performance of employees
  • Work with FSM to create in-store training program for employees
  • Work with FSM to achieve financial goals for the business
  • Use judgment and decision making skills to control expenses

Experience

  • Has demonstrated ability to drive the business and lead by example
  • Supports all Corporate programs within the business
  • Ability to prioritize activities quickly in response to changing initiatives
  • Must work effectively with all Employees and management teams
  • Superior interpersonal and coaching skills
  • Supervisory experience
  • Retail/grocery experience
  • Superior interpersonal skills
  • Efficient time management ability
  • Financial analysis ability
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Effective organization and planning skills
  • Computer literacy
  • Commitment to providing exceptional customer service

WORKING CONDITIONS

  • Ability to work flexible shifts which may include nights and weekends

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds
  • Ability to climb ladder

The above statement reflects the general details considered necessary to describe the principal functions and duties as required for proper evaluation of the job and shall not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be inherent in the job.

J2WRTL
J2WFSM

Why work in a Shoppers Drug Mart store?

Each store has an Associate-Owner, so you will work for a local business owner while having the support of a national brand. Benefit from a purchase discount program, flexible and varied schedules, competitive pay and online learning through Academy.

Take ownership of your work and find more ways to care about your patients, co-workers, customers and community.

Associate Owners in the Shoppers Drug Mart network recognize Canada's diversity as an opportunity to better serve their communities, and strive to reflect the nation’s evolving diversity in the products they sell, the people they hire, and the culture they create in their stores. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants and colleagues with disabilities.

In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

title: Registered Physiotherapist (PT)
description:
Physiotherapist Position Available in Scarborough, Ontario.
We have an immediate position available for a Registered Physiotherapist. The position is part-time that can transition to full-time. Both experienced physiotherapists and new graduates are welcome to apply.
Friendly Rehab is a well-established private practice serving the Scarborough area for over 30 years. We are a busy, multidisciplinary, progressively thinking company with a modern approach to client care looking to hire the right physiotherapist to work alongside our team of health professionals.
We have developed a strong referral base with local medical and legal professionals and have an excellent relationship with insurers. We have a strong repeat client base and offer a friendly work environment with a strong emphasis on teamwork and client-centered care.
Our clients may present with a myriad of musculoskeletal injuries and a variety of post-operative care needs.
We have worked diligently towards putting all necessary safety precautions and protocols in place and minimize all unnecessary traffic within the clinic.

Roles include:
  • Performing clinical assessments, creating and implementing treatment plans for clients.
  • Providing ongoing evaluation and revision of client treatment programs.
  • Communicating with patients and coordinating with staff members.
  • Engaging in continuous learning and skills development.
  • Contributing to a positive patient experience.
  • Experience with MVA and WSIB cases is an asset.
  • Record keeping (SOAP notes).
  • Communicating with client referral sources.

Qualified candidates must:
  • Be licensed and in good standing with the College of Physiotherapy, Ontario Physiotherapy Association (or will soon be eligible) and have malpractice insurance.
  • Have current CPR certification.
  • Have excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Demonstrate effectiveness as an interdisciplinary team member.
  • Demonstrate problem-solving skills, good judgment and flexibility.
  • Be familiar will all modalities including: Shockwave Therapy, Decompression Table, Laser Therapy, Ultrasound, IFC/TENS.

We Offer:
  • A collaborative work environment with other health care professionals.
  • All administrative support and supplies.
  • Working in a clean environment, treatment rooms with plenty of natural light, kitchen for staff in place, fridge and microwave.
  • Bi-weekly payroll.
  • Free Parking.

Benefits:
  • Convenient TTC locations- Warden and Kennedy.
  • Compliance with the Ministry of Health Guidance regarding COVID19.

Please send resumes to : info@friendlyrehab.ca.

title: Project Manager (Traffic Signal Design)
description:
Company Description


We are a global architecture, engineering, planning, and technology firm defining the cities of tomorrow.

By connecting design and technology, we change how people experience their built environment. We work across disciplines to create the intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, and efficient infrastructure that shapes the way people live, move, learn, and heal.

With over 3,000 employees and 60+ offices around the world, we understand what it takes to work locally and scale globally.

At IBI, we’re defining the cities of tomorrow.


Job Description


Most of the things you'll work on:

  • Prepare Traffic Signal Design in urban environment.
  • Develop traffic signal and traffic control devices designs in Microstation, AutoCAD, and Civil 3D.
  • Direct, supervise, and mentor Microstation drafting technicians.
  • Design Experience in Temporary Traffic Control environment, functional roadway and intersection geometric, pavement marking and signage, AODA accessible path criteria, bicycle facilities, traffic signal system equipment, and roadway infrastructure dimensional relationship, and utility clearances.
  • Contribute significantly to and lead the successful design, production, coordination and management of Traffic signal design and consultancy projects.
  • Research into latest technology for traffic control devices, prepare technical reports, tender and contract documentation.
  • Conduct field support with respect to Traffic signal equipment and cabinet equipment setup and commissioning as may be required.
  • Communicate effectively with clients and internal team members (Engineers, Architects, Designers and Project Managers) in the design and specification development of Traffic Control Devices projects within an integrated multi-disciplinary project delivery team.
  • Ensure accuracy, completeness and quality of technical information and project documentation in accordance with QA/QC programs.
  • Ensure that engineering deliverables (e.g., drawings, specifications, analysis, budget estimates) comply with applicable regulations, standards, corporate procedures and sound engineering practices.
  • Initiate and work with drafting staff to complete engineering drawings
  • Liaise with clients, contractors, and the public.
  • Mentor and direct two to three designers or engineers.
  • Take directions from Associates or Associate Directors.
  • Client relationship building and management including but not limited to taking part in business development activities, proposal preparation, procuring staff resources, establishing project budgets and schedules, etc.
  • Prepare technical reports, tender documentation and field support (including commissioning/site inspection).
  • Ensure that project deliverables are met in a timely manner to a high quality including engineering stamped drawings and preparing final stamped reports.

Qualifications


You'll need to have:

  • University Degree or Diploma in Civil Engineering or Electrical Engineering focused on transportation and/or traffic engineering.
  • 12+ years’ relevant experience in traffic/transit engineering design and operations (in a consulting environment) with proven experience in Temporary Traffic Control Design and Inspection, Functional Roadway and Intersection design, Traffic Control System Commissioning, Temporary Staging, and Traffic Operations/Analysis.
  • Certification as a Professional Traffic Operations Engineer (PTOE)
  • Design and commissioning experience with BRT, LRT, and Rail signal priority and pre-emption system is preferred; ie: Traffic Control Devices Design and System commissioning; Previous experience in P3 linear Traffic Signal Design and/or Owner’s Engineers environment preferred.
  • Should have experience with local municipalities such as York Region, Waterloo Region, City of Toronto, London region and clients such as the MTO.
  • Experience with softwares such as Synchro / SimTraffic, HCS, and roundabout operations analysis applications, engineering software such as Microstation, AutoTurn, AutoCAD, Civil 3D design software is preferred.
  • Experience working in a multi-disciplinary team delivering various projects in complexity and size/scope
  • Strong interpersonal communications skills applicable both internally with project delivery staff as well as externally with project partners (clients, consultants, contractors and regulatory authorities)
  • Familiarity with Ontario Traffic Manuals, Highway Traffic Acts, Ontario Regulations, TAC, MUTCDC, City of Toronto engineering standard(s)/guidelines/regulations, MTO OPSS/OPSD, Canadian Electrical Code, Ontario Regulations 22/04 and associated pole-loading calculations, and OPSS Standards
  • Strong interpersonal communications skills applicable both internally with project delivery staff as well as externally with project partners (clients, consultants, contractors and regulatory authorities)
  • A valid, Class G, Ontario driver’s licence
  • Occasional travel is required.

Additional Information


We are currently in a work from home model during COVID-19, but when we do return to the office we're located on the 3rd floor of 8133 Warden Avenue, our Markham office in the Remington Corporate Centre is situated in the heart of Canada’s High-Tech Capital, Downtown Markham. This fast growing, master-planned community is immersed with public art, landscaped green space and a truly unique mix of amenities, seamlessly connected to public transit and major roadways. The neighbourhood is evolving into York Region’s premier hub of culture, education, commerce and entertainment. The office is in close proximity to the Markham Pan Am Centre, Unionville Go Station, and York University’s new Markham Centre campus opening in 2021. As one of IBI Group’s newest offices, the facility reflects the most up to date standards and design technology for an inviting and productive workspace, all to better serve clients of the region.

Our employees enjoy our small office feel and all the perks of a big office support system. You’ll have direct access to management while benefitting from our enthusiastic and helpful organizational resources team. The floors are open concept and creative and represent our collaborative approach to projects. As a global architecture, engineering and technology design firm, IBI Group also has offices across the country, continent and world.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record. Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada.

title: Senior Transportation Engineer (Hybrid)
description:
Company Description

We are a global architecture, engineering, planning, and technology firm defining the cities of tomorrow.

By connecting design and technology, we change how people experience their built environment. We work across disciplines to create the intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, and efficient infrastructure that shapes the way people live, move, learn, and heal.

With over 3,000 employees and 60 offices around the world, we understand what it takes to work locally and scale globally.

At IBI, we’re defining the cities of tomorrow.

Job Description

Why Join the IBI Family:

IBI Group’s Markham office is searching for a Senior Transportation Engineer to join its growing team.  We take pride in offering career growth and challenging opportunities within a global organization, solving today’s difficult urban issues. If successful, you will work on major transit/subway projects, alongside a supportive team of industry-leading experts!  The goal of the projects is to foster sustainable and healthy communities in the Greater Toronto Area by adding capacity and connectivity to an existing busy transit network and connecting to a number of other transit systems to make it easier to travel within the city and beyond!

Our Team practices flexible working arrangements, including flexible work hours, plus we support your working from home. As a leader, you’ll be expected to attend meetings at your home office in Markham, and at client offices and sites. You can also take advantage and work from any of our Greater Toronto Area and Hamilton offices.

What You Will Bring to the Company:

As a Senior Transportation Engineer, you will undertake complex assignments requiring a diverse knowledge of transportation engineering, design principles and practices, and transportation planning. With a working knowledge of all engineering disciplines related to environmental assessments for transportation projects, you will use your experience and judgement to solve problems for a wide range of public sector clients.

Most of the Things You’ll Work on:

  • Oversee the transportation team working on P3 projects. This work includes both Temporary Traffic and Transit Management Plans (TTMP) and permanent design for large scale transit projects
  • Act as Technical Advisor (TA) responsible for the preparation of the Reference Concept Design (RCD) and Project Specific Output Specifications (PSOS)
  • Responsible for necessary design activities to advance the work through the bid phase
  • Develop innovative and practical design solutions within the bounds of good civil design
  • Work closely with traffic, utilities, natural, heritage, urban design and other disciplines to develop solutions
  • Prepare design concepts related to active transportation projects, traffic impact studies, parking and traffic calming studies, and traffic management plans
  • Prepare technical reports, presentations, and other documentation, including cost estimates
  • Review drawings and perform quality control checks on drawings and reports
  • Follow quality assurance/quality control, and health and safety requirements
Qualifications

You'll Need to Have:

  • Professional Engineer (P. Eng.) Degree
  • 10 years traffic engineering experience, preferably in large-scale P3 Projects
  • Proven analytical and problem solving skills for dealing with complex transportation engineering assignments with minimal direction
  • Experience in transportation planning, including the feasibility and preliminary design of new or enhanced BRT, LRT, road and highway facilities
  • Experience in transit infrastructure and stations, parking, and active transportation facilities is an asset
  • Experience with project management and/or construction management is an asset.
  • Strong verbal communication and presentation skills
  • Excellent time management skills
  • Ability to be flexible and collaborate, while maintaining quality work within a fast paced environment


Additional Information

We are currently exclusively on a work from home model during COVID-19. On return to office, we will support a highly flexible working arrangement with work-from-home and work-from-office options, and multiple office locations across the GTHA to choose from. Our home office for this assignment is located in the Remington Corporate Centre and is situated in the heart of Canada’s High-Tech Capital, Downtown Markham. As one of IBI Group’s newest offices, the facility reflects the most up to date standards and design technology for an inviting and productive workspace, all to better serve clients of the region. 

IBI Group provides a competitive benefit package and pays association dues and licensing fees.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record.Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada.

title: Registered Physiotherapist (PT)
description:
Physiotherapist Position Available in Scarborough, Ontario.

We have an immediate position available for a Registered Physiotherapist. The position is part-time that can transition to full-time. Both experienced physiotherapists and new graduates are welcome to apply.

Friendly Rehab is a well-established private practice serving the Scarborough area for over 30 years. We are a busy, multidisciplinary, progressively thinking company with a modern approach to client care looking to hire the right physiotherapist to work alongside our team of health professionals.

We have developed a strong referral base with local medical and legal professionals and have an excellent relationship with insurers. We have a strong repeat client base and offer a friendly work environment with a strong emphasis on teamwork and client-centered care.

Our clients may present with a myriad of musculoskeletal injuries and a variety of post-operative care needs.

We have worked diligently towards putting all necessary safety precautions and protocols in place and minimize all unnecessary traffic within the clinic.

Roles include:
  • Performing clinical assessments, creating and implementing treatment plans for clients.
  • Providing ongoing evaluation and revision of client treatment programs.
  • Communicating with patients and coordinating with staff members.
  • Engaging in continuous learning and skills development.
  • Contributing to a positive patient experience.
  • Experience with MVA and WSIB cases is an asset.
  • Record keeping (SOAP notes).
  • Communicating with client referral sources.

Qualified candidates must:
  • Be licensed and in good standing with the College of Physiotherapy, Ontario Physiotherapy Association (or will soon be eligible) and have malpractice insurance.
  • Have current CPR certification.
  • Have excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Demonstrate effectiveness as an interdisciplinary team member.
  • Demonstrate problem-solving skills, good judgment and flexibility.
  • Be familiar will all modalities including: Shockwave Therapy, Decompression Table, Laser Therapy, Ultrasound, IFC/TENS.

We Offer:
  • A collaborative work environment with other health care professionals.
  • All administrative support and supplies.
  • Working in a clean environment, treatment rooms with plenty of natural light, kitchen for staff in place, fridge and microwave.
  • Bi-weekly payroll.
  • Free Parking.

Benefits:
  • Convenient TTC locations- Warden and Kennedy.
  • Compliance with the Ministry of Health Guidance regarding COVID19.

Please send resumes to : info@friendlyrehab.ca.

title: Operations Coordinator (Parks Worker)
description:
Parks West Enterprise Inc. is responsible for managing the Buntzen Lake Recreation Area. Our team prides itself in maintaining a safe, clean, family-oriented recreation area.

The Operations Coordinator (OC) works alongside the Operations Manager and Maintenance Manager in managing operations at the Buntzen Lake Recreation Area.

The OC is responsible for deploying staff, directing operations, and acting as Incident Commander during emergencies. They are hard-working leaders, ensuring all staff are well-informed, organized and working safely.

They help develop and implement new staff policies, procedures and training. They have a detailed understanding of all aspects of park operations and are assigned projects to complete.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Upholding the Core Values of Parks West Enterprise Inc. (see parkswest.ca) and holding staff to these values
  • Acting as the delegate for the Warden &/or Assistant warden when they are not present
  • Ensuring that the public are safe, that they are following recreation area rules, and that staff are working towards this objective
  • Managing staff – ensure staff are safe, motivated and productive
  • Leading emergency response as Incident Commander
  • Providing workplace first aid in the event of staff injuries
  • Organizing park maintenance tasks to specified standards, such as vegetation management, painting, cleaning, etc. and assisting in park maintenance
  • Ensuring daily routines including correct opening &/or closing procedures are followed
  • Recognizing & addressing safety hazards
  • Contributing to daily safety meetings.
  • Responding to changing conditions, such as weather, traffic, wildlife activity, etc.
  • Performing inspections of infrastructure and grounds (i.e. beaches, bridges)
  • Hiring new staff through job postings, interviews, etc.
  • Training staff and developing training programs
  • Conducting performance reviews and administering disciplinary policies
  • Planning and execution of special projects (e.g. Signage plans, Emergency procedures)
  • Managing the office, keeping it tidy, answering the phone, receiving outside agencies, etc.
  • Responding to emails, creating and managing detailed electronic documents. Keeping well organized records and files.
  • Comprehensively understanding and implementing rules, safety policies, operational protocol, etc.

APPLICANT REQUIREMENTS

  • Minimum 2 years of supervisor, management or leadership experience in a park environment
  • Mature, professional attitude, ability to take detailed instructions and receive extensive training
  • Positive leadership skills, able to confidently direct and lead by example. Team-based, non-prejudice and respectful approach
  • Able to remain calm and focused in potentially stressful situations
  • Able to seek help / delegate when appropriate
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Detail-oriented, able to understand and apply company policies, safety protocol, best work practices, etc. Able to produce detailed and clear reports, inspections and other documents.
  • Able to work outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Self-motivated and able to keep others on task
  • Good physical fitness; can walk or stand for prolonged periods of time and lift heavy objects, able to hike for hours in mountainous terrain on occasion
  • Available to work 8 hour shifts between 7am - 10pm and work over-time in emergency situations (shifts finish earlier in the winter).
  • Capable of swimming to safety in unlikely event of water immersion
  • Minimum Occupational First Aid Level 1
  • Valid class 5 BC Driver’s license with clean drivers abstract
  • A PCOC must be acquired if hired
  • WHMIS qualification is required if hired
  • Steel toed boots are required if hired

Additional training will be provided to successful candidates

PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO APPLICANTS WHO ARE / HAVE...

  • Qualified or experienced in first aid / emergency response / incident command (particularly OFA and ICS)
  • Knowledge / experience in workplace safety (practices, legislation, implementation, etc.)
  • Experienced in enforcement, conflict resolution or violence prevention
  • Fire suppression experience, including S-100 qualification or above
  • Experienced in landscaping and/or vegetation maintenance**
  • Previously been employed to drive a vehicle or have driven trucks / large vehicles
  • Previously worked / volunteered driving a boat or otherwise have relevant boating experience
  • Mechanical, construction or repair experience
  • Experienced in customer service / working with the public
  • Experienced in word processing, spreadsheet and/or graphics software

SCHEDULE

**This is a full-time, permanent position

5 x 8 hour shifts/week with 2 consecutive days off

Applicants must be available to work weekends

Work Remotely

  • No

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $27.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Every Weekend
  • Holidays
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, strict safety procedures are in place to reduce the risk of transmission within the workplace. Staff are provided with masks, gloves and training on cleaning procedures to effectively disinfect touched surfaces.

Experience:

  • parks worker: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Class 5 License (required)

Shift availability:

  • Day Shift (required)
  • Night Shift (preferred)
Show more

title: Assistant Front Store Manager LG FRMT
description:
Location:

8601 Warden Avenue, Markham, Ontario, L3R 0B5

Join a locally owned and operated store to help deliver health, beauty and convenience services in your community, and keep the customer at the centre of everything you do.



Why this role is important?

SUMMARY:

To assist the Front Store Manager (FSM) in managing the human, physical and financial resources of the store and in ensuring that store objectives are achieved by focusing on improving product flow from the backroom to the sales floor.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Operations

  • Role models best practice customer service at Shoppers Drug Mart
  • Supports Loss Prevention processes related to cash management and Front Store processes to minimize risk
  • Participates in hiring/onboarding of new cashiers
  • Ensures all Cash staff have completed cash training and customer service training through SDMU
  • Identifies and trains Supervisors from existing cashiers where possible
  • Follows up with Supervisors to ensure communication cascade for evening /weekend huddles and timely updates as required
  • Update Process Board with tasks from store walk
  • Ensures tasks get accomplished in a timely fashion
  • Ensures that backroom inventory management initiative (BIMI) is to standard at all times
  • Generates daily low stock report and provides to merchandisers/section captains
  • Communicates expected deliveries with receiver to develop an action plan for receiving
  • Role models and monitors adherence to receiving principles focusing on totes first and sorting techniques

Customer Service

  • Proactively engages customers with increased focus during peak traffic times
  • Assists FSM to ensure all product-related processes are implemented effectively
  • Highlights new products, reinforces with staff the need to share upcoming events with customers, recognizes CSI performers during Daily Huddle / Shift
  • Coaches and trains all new merchandising hires on Store Standards
  • Ensures that exceptional customer service is provided beyond expectation, as outlined in the Store Operating Standards
  • Ensures employees present proper image to the public in accordance with Uniform Policy and Dress Code Guidelines (i.e. clean appearance, approved uniform, name badge)
  • Answers inquiries (ie. location of product, rainchecks) and resolves customer complaints according to guidelines
  • Demonstrates product knowledge and familiarity with location of products throughout the store
  • Empowers employees to ensure customer satisfaction

Marketing and Merchandising

  • Oversees implementation of store marketing programs
  • Spotlights new or exclusive products at daily huddles
  • Ensures staff know about upcoming events to share with customers
  • Recognizes CSI performers
  • Oversees PC Optimum program including communication of performance and review and follows up of individual operator ID performance for sign-ups and email captures
  • Assists the FSM in adherence to all marketing programs and initiatives, which may include: 1) Retail price management 2) Planograms, core programs, and merchandising techniques 3) Flyer implementation and local advertising initiatives
  • Creates and maintains proper displays to reflect seasonal and promotional programs
  • Ensures value events are set-up and taken down according to schedule
  • Works with FSM to ensure signage in the store reflects current programs, policies, and procedures
  • Responsible for replenishment orders in absence of FSM

Human Resources

  • Assists in the hiring process for Front End Cashiers/Supervisors (recommend to FSM)
  • Ensures staff is properly trained in all aspects of their role and provides on-going coaching and instructions
  • Assists in ongoing employee performance management and development, including performance reviews, progressive discipline with FSM
  • Complies with employment legislation
  • Ensures employees comply with all policies and procedures

Finance

  • Assists in achieving projected sales growth targets
  • Assists in effective expense management

General

  • Complies with all health and safety regulations
  • Complies with all store policies and procedures
  • Complies with loss prevention policies and procedures and ensures they are executed in the department
  • Ensures Store Standards are followed
  • Maintains confidentiality in all matters pertaining to Shoppers Drug Mart franchised business and its operation
  • Perform other duties as assigned

Management/Supervision/Leadership

  • Provides support to all non Rx parties within the local store
  • Provides direction under the guidance of FSM

QUALIFICATIONS

Planning, Judgement and Decision Making

  • Independent thinking and decision making – Makes decisions when dealing with issues or problems that occur when the FSM is not available. Consultation with the FSM for significant changes.
  • Ability to plan, coordinate and delegate assignments as well as the ability to provide coaching to employees
  • Planning and preparation for Inventory management
  • Monitor service levels on SKUs to control inventory
  • Identify overstock and develop a clearance strategy
  • Identify and recognize superior performance of employees
  • Work with FSM to create in-store training program for employees
  • Work with FSM to achieve financial goals for the business
  • Use judgment and decision making skills to control expenses

Experience

  • Has demonstrated ability to drive the business and lead by example
  • Supports all Corporate programs within the business
  • Ability to prioritize activities quickly in response to changing initiatives
  • Must work effectively with all Employees and management teams
  • Superior interpersonal and coaching skills
  • Supervisory experience
  • Retail/grocery experience
  • Superior interpersonal skills
  • Efficient time management ability
  • Financial analysis ability
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Effective organization and planning skills
  • Computer literacy
  • Commitment to providing exceptional customer service

WORKING CONDITIONS

  • Ability to work flexible shifts which may include nights and weekends

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds
  • Ability to climb ladder

The above statement reflects the general details considered necessary to describe the principal functions and duties as required for proper evaluation of the job and shall not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be inherent in the job.

J2WRTL
J2WFSM

Why work in a Shoppers Drug Mart store?

Each store has an Associate-Owner, so you will work for a local business owner while having the support of a national brand. Benefit from a purchase discount program, flexible and varied schedules, competitive pay and online learning through Academy.

Take ownership of your work and find more ways to care about your patients, co-workers, customers and community.

Associate Owners in the Shoppers Drug Mart network recognize Canada's diversity as an opportunity to better serve their communities, and strive to reflect the nation’s evolving diversity in the products they sell, the people they hire, and the culture they create in their stores. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants and colleagues with disabilities.

In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

Show more

title: General Kitchen Helper
description:
Job Purpose

The General Helper actively participates in the daily operation of the camp catering unit.

Duties and Responsibilities

· The basic preparation of food and beverages including the preparation of vegetables and snacks.

· Simple cooking including the reconstitution of prepared food.

· General kitchen and dining room duties including washing up, setting up and clearing away equipment and tables, cleaning of the kitchen and dining room surrounds and, equipment to include all work surfaces, dining furniture, floors and walls.

  • Sweep and scrub floors.
  • Remove garbage.
  • Clean kitchen equipment.
  • Scrape food from plates and wash food trays.
  • Wash dishes as required.
  • Clean flatware, and wash pots and pans.
  • Assist in receiving and storing supplies.
  • Stock cupboards, refrigerators and salad bars.
  • Assist in basic food preparation.
  • Prepare ingredients (for example, wash and slice vegetables).
  • Package take-out foods.
  • Perform other duties as directed by the Chef.

Qualifications

· Food Safe Certification.

· Experience working in a kitchen setting.

  • Experience working a rotational schedule in a seasonal remote camp environment.

· Excellent communication skills.

Working Conditions

The special working conditions entails work dependent on the industry and weather, 12 hour day and/or night shift work, 3 weeks in and 1 week out rotational schedule, and being isolated for periods of time.

Physical Requirement

General Helper position requires standing for extended periods of time, lifting and carrying heavy objects (50+ pounds) on a regular basis, and performing repetitive tasks with few breaks.

Safety Responsibility

Attend and participate in daily Toolbox Meetings and weekly Safety Meetings.

Report all incidents, near misses, injuries and property damage incidents to the supervisor immediately.

Perform Fire Warden duties, as required.

Job Types: Full-time, Seasonal

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $15.00-$17.00 per hour

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $15.00-$17.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Extended health care

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift
  • Overtime

COVID-19 considerations:
All employees will take a Rapid Test every 3 days and be masked in high traffic areas. Candidates will be required to be fully vaccinated to be considered for the position.

Application question(s):

  • When would you be available to start working?

Work remotely:

  • No
Show more

title: Camp Attendant
description:
Job Purpose

The Seasonal Camp Attendant is responsible for ensuring the living area of the camp is clean and sanitary. They will consistently provide positive service and assistance with all camp employees and guests while making sure to follow all policies and guidelines as set out by Health and Safety Guidelines.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Keep the living areas of the camp in a clean and sanitary manner (sleeping quarters, hallways, washrooms, and entrance ways).
  • Vacuum and sweep daily.
  • Empty garbage cans in all rooms daily
  • Wash all towels, aprons, etc. as required in the a.m. or early p.m. to leave machines free for the crews to do their laundry.
  • Clean lint screens in the dryer after every load.
  • Make beds daily and change linen weekly or as required.
  • Keep an accurate record of housekeeping supplies and store in a secure place to discourage loss.
  • Keep sidewalks and walkways clean of debris, snow and ice.
  • Clean the inside of windows weekly and wash down the outside windows of the camps as required.
  • Ensure no leaks or garbage is around the camps and that the shutters on the outside of the camp are open (not closed).
  • Follow all guidelines as set out by the HACCP (Hazard Analysis Critical Control Points).
  • Camp Attendant’s duties are not limited to the job description as each client may have different requirements.

Qualifications

  • Previous experience cleaning in camps is considered an asset.
  • 2+ years’ experience working a rotational schedule in a seasonal remote camp environment.
  • Excellent attention to detail with an ability to work independently and in a team environment.

Working Conditions

The special working conditions entails seasonal work dependent on the industry and weather, 12 hour shift work, 3 weeks in and 1 week out rotational schedule, and being isolated for periods of time.

Physical Requirements

Seasonal Camp Attendant position requires standing for extended periods of time, lifting and carrying heavy objects (50+ pounds) on a regular basis, and performing repetitive tasks with few breaks.

Safety Responsibility

Attend and participate in daily Toolbox Meetings and weekly Safety Meetings

Report all incidents, near misses, injuries and property damage incidents to the supervisor immediately

Perform Fire Warden duties, as required

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $15.00-$16.00 per hour

COVID-19 considerations:
All employees will take a Rapid Test every 3 days and be masked in high traffic areas. Candidates will be required to be fully vaccinated to be considered for the position.

Application question(s):

  • When would you be available to start working?
Show more

title: Senior Infrastructure Support Analyst
description:
Requisition ID: 139976

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.


The team:

Scotiabank’s Global Technology Services (GTS) - Data Centre Network Services team is responsible for level 3 support & project deployments, both on premise Data Centres and the Cloud, to support the digital transformation of the Bank’s global network. We are responsible for supporting and deploying new technologies, following best practices, and consulting and coordinating with the Bank’s many technology teams with the aim of providing a highly resilient network as the underlying core of the Bank’s technology infrastructure. As part of the larger Global Network Services team, there is involvement in end-to-end network connectivity and solutioning for data centre network services, campus and remote office integrations as well as perimeter security network technologies.


The role:

We are filling multiple positions at our Scarborough IT Campus.


You will play a critical part in helping the team support the various technologies within our Global Network.


You will be expected to be a part of the teams’ rotational on-call duties and, when required, be a part of after-hours project deployments in the evenings or weekends.


Is this role right for you?

  • You are eager to work with leading edge technologies to incorporate complex network solutions, as well as work with other technology teams to contribute to an overall solution.
  • You thrive on being hands-on during mid to complex project deployments into production. This will include the support of assigned systems by acting as an internal consultant on assigned infrastructure and providing suggestions for viable solutions to systems problems of high complexity.
  • You want to be challenged with complex problem solving in time sensitive situations to reduce system downtime and customer impact.
  • You understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
  • You are highly interested in software-defined Data Centre technologies like Cisco ACI and VMWare NSX and want to help drive the road-map and adoption within a large-scale enterprise network.
  • You are interested in getting in on the Cloud floor as the team gets more hands on with the network in the Public Cloud, including environments like Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Microsoft Azure and IBM SoftLayer.


Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role?

  • You have strong communication (verbal/written) and good interpersonal skills to build relationships with internal and external business partners and vendors.
  • You have at least 8+ years of progressive hands-on technical working experience, which includes designing, deploying & supporting various network technologies at an enterprise scale.
  • You have at least 5+ years of hands-on technical working experience with Cisco Routers & Switches like:
  • Cisco® Nexus N9K/N7K/N5K/N2K Solutions
  • Cisco® Integrated Services Routers (ISR) & Aggregation Services Routers (ASR)
  • Cisco® Catalyst N9K
  • You have at least 5+ years of hands-on technical working experience with Cisco® Security/VPN.
  • You have at least 3+ years of hands-on technical working experience with firewall technologies like Fortigate/Cisco® Firepower Threat Defense (FTD).
  • You have at least 5+ years of hands-on technical working experience with F5® BIG-IP® Local Traffic Manager™ (LTM) / Global Traffic Manager™ (GTM).
  • You have at least 5+ years of hands-on technical working experience with Infoblox NIOS products, such as: DDI - DNS, DHCP & IP Address Management (IPAM).
  • You have at least 2 years of hands-on technical working experience with software-defined networking (SDN) technologies like Cisco® Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI™), VMware NSX® or similar.
  • You can demonstrate hands-on technical working experience in managing Public Cloud (Microsoft Azure & Google Cloud Platform preferred) environments, in a network related capacity.
  • You have hands-on technical working experience with Wired and Wireless 802.1x Network Authentication using Cisco® Identity Services Engine (ISE).
  • You have hands-on technical working experience with network automation scripting from Python, REST API endpoint.
  • You possess superior problem solving and decision-making skills to resolve work issues with the ability to work under pressure in a dynamic environment.
  • Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Engineering, Networking Technology or in a related field.


What's in it for you?

  • You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world.
  • We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success! We also foster an environment of innovation and continuous learning.
  • We care about our people, allowing them to design how they work to deliver amazing results.
  • We offer a competitive total rewards package, including a performance bonus, company matching programs (pension & Employee Share Ownership), generous vacation; health/medical/wellness benefits; employee banking privileges.
  • While we currently work remotely from home, when required to be onsite, our primary office in Scarborough is:
  • Renovated with a design focus on enabling collaboration through both environment and technology.
  • Furnished with an onsite cafeteria that serves hot foods, salads, sandwiches & snacks.
  • Equipped for breaks with table tennis, table soccer, pool table & TV’s. Our lounges have fridges, microwaves, complimentary hot beverage stations & water dispensers.
  • Minutes by TTC bus from Warden subway station on Line 2. Free employee shuttle service connecting the IT campus with nearby GO stations. 2023 opening of the Eglinton Crosstown Light Rail Transit with the Birchmount stop that’s steps away.
  • Minutes from the 401 & DVP. Free onsite & offsite employee parking with charging stations for electric vehicles onsite.


Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Scarborough

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Registered Physiotherapist (PT)
description:
Physiotherapist Position Available in Scarborough, Ontario.
We have an immediate position available for a Registered Physiotherapist. The position is part-time that can transition to full-time. Both experienced physiotherapists and new graduates are welcome to apply.
Friendly Rehab is a well-established private practice serving the Scarborough area for over 30 years. We are a busy, multidisciplinary, progressively thinking company with a modern approach to client care looking to hire the right physiotherapist to work alongside our team of health professionals.
We have developed a strong referral base with local medical and legal professionals and have an excellent relationship with insurers. We have a strong repeat client base and offer a friendly work environment with a strong emphasis on teamwork and client-centered care.
Our clients may present with a myriad of musculoskeletal injuries and a variety of post-operative care needs.
We have worked diligently towards putting all necessary safety precautions and protocols in place and minimize all unnecessary traffic within the clinic.

Roles include:
  • Performing clinical assessments, creating and implementing treatment plans for clients.
  • Providing ongoing evaluation and revision of client treatment programs.
  • Communicating with patients and coordinating with staff members.
  • Engaging in continuous learning and skills development.
  • Contributing to a positive patient experience.
  • Experience with MVA and WSIB cases is an asset.
  • Record keeping (SOAP notes).
  • Communicating with client referral sources.

Qualified candidates must:
  • Be licensed and in good standing with the College of Physiotherapy, Ontario Physiotherapy Association (or will soon be eligible) and have malpractice insurance.
  • Have current CPR certification.
  • Have excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Demonstrate effectiveness as an interdisciplinary team member.
  • Demonstrate problem-solving skills, good judgment and flexibility.
  • Be familiar will all modalities including: Shockwave Therapy, Decompression Table, Laser Therapy, Ultrasound, IFC/TENS.

We Offer:
  • A collaborative work environment with other health care professionals.
  • All administrative support and supplies.
  • Working in a clean environment, treatment rooms with plenty of natural light, kitchen for staff in place, fridge and microwave.
  • Bi-weekly payroll.
  • Free Parking.

Benefits:
  • Convenient TTC locations- Warden and Kennedy.
  • Compliance with the Ministry of Health Guidance regarding COVID19.

Please send resumes to : info@friendlyrehab.ca.
Show more
