title: Camp Attendant
description:
Job Purpose

The Seasonal Camp Attendant is responsible for ensuring the living area of the camp is clean and sanitary. They will consistently provide positive service and assistance with all camp employees and guests while making sure to follow all policies and guidelines as set out by Health and Safety Guidelines.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Keep the living areas of the camp in a clean and sanitary manner (sleeping quarters, hallways, washrooms, and entrance ways).
  • Vacuum and sweep daily.
  • Empty garbage cans in all rooms daily
  • Wash all towels, aprons, etc. as required in the a.m. or early p.m. to leave machines free for the crews to do their laundry.
  • Clean lint screens in the dryer after every load.
  • Make beds daily and change linen weekly or as required.
  • Keep an accurate record of housekeeping supplies and store in a secure place to discourage loss.
  • Keep sidewalks and walkways clean of debris, snow and ice.
  • Clean the inside of windows weekly and wash down the outside windows of the camps as required.
  • Ensure no leaks or garbage is around the camps and that the shutters on the outside of the camp are open (not closed).
  • Follow all guidelines as set out by the HACCP (Hazard Analysis Critical Control Points).
  • Camp Attendant’s duties are not limited to the job description as each client may have different requirements.

Qualifications

  • Previous experience cleaning in camps is considered an asset.
  • 2+ years’ experience working a rotational schedule in a seasonal remote camp environment.
  • Excellent attention to detail with an ability to work independently and in a team environment.

Working Conditions

The special working conditions entails seasonal work dependent on the industry and weather, 12 hour shift work, 3 weeks in and 1 week out rotational schedule, and being isolated for periods of time.

Physical Requirements

Seasonal Camp Attendant position requires standing for extended periods of time, lifting and carrying heavy objects (50+ pounds) on a regular basis, and performing repetitive tasks with few breaks.

Safety Responsibility

Attend and participate in daily Toolbox Meetings and weekly Safety Meetings

Report all incidents, near misses, injuries and property damage incidents to the supervisor immediately

Perform Fire Warden duties, as required

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $15.00-$16.00 per hour

COVID-19 considerations:
All employees will take a Rapid Test every 3 days and be masked in high traffic areas. Candidates will be required to be fully vaccinated to be considered for the position.

Application question(s):

  • When would you be available to start working?
Show more

title: Senior Infrastructure Support Analyst
description:
Requisition ID: 139976

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.


The team:

Scotiabank’s Global Technology Services (GTS) - Data Centre Network Services team is responsible for level 3 support & project deployments, both on premise Data Centres and the Cloud, to support the digital transformation of the Bank’s global network. We are responsible for supporting and deploying new technologies, following best practices, and consulting and coordinating with the Bank’s many technology teams with the aim of providing a highly resilient network as the underlying core of the Bank’s technology infrastructure. As part of the larger Global Network Services team, there is involvement in end-to-end network connectivity and solutioning for data centre network services, campus and remote office integrations as well as perimeter security network technologies.


The role:

We are filling multiple positions at our Scarborough IT Campus.


You will play a critical part in helping the team support the various technologies within our Global Network.


You will be expected to be a part of the teams’ rotational on-call duties and, when required, be a part of after-hours project deployments in the evenings or weekends.


Is this role right for you?

  • You are eager to work with leading edge technologies to incorporate complex network solutions, as well as work with other technology teams to contribute to an overall solution.
  • You thrive on being hands-on during mid to complex project deployments into production. This will include the support of assigned systems by acting as an internal consultant on assigned infrastructure and providing suggestions for viable solutions to systems problems of high complexity.
  • You want to be challenged with complex problem solving in time sensitive situations to reduce system downtime and customer impact.
  • You understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
  • You are highly interested in software-defined Data Centre technologies like Cisco ACI and VMWare NSX and want to help drive the road-map and adoption within a large-scale enterprise network.
  • You are interested in getting in on the Cloud floor as the team gets more hands on with the network in the Public Cloud, including environments like Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Microsoft Azure and IBM SoftLayer.


Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role?

  • You have strong communication (verbal/written) and good interpersonal skills to build relationships with internal and external business partners and vendors.
  • You have at least 8+ years of progressive hands-on technical working experience, which includes designing, deploying & supporting various network technologies at an enterprise scale.
  • You have at least 5+ years of hands-on technical working experience with Cisco Routers & Switches like:
  • Cisco® Nexus N9K/N7K/N5K/N2K Solutions
  • Cisco® Integrated Services Routers (ISR) & Aggregation Services Routers (ASR)
  • Cisco® Catalyst N9K
  • You have at least 5+ years of hands-on technical working experience with Cisco® Security/VPN.
  • You have at least 3+ years of hands-on technical working experience with firewall technologies like Fortigate/Cisco® Firepower Threat Defense (FTD).
  • You have at least 5+ years of hands-on technical working experience with F5® BIG-IP® Local Traffic Manager™ (LTM) / Global Traffic Manager™ (GTM).
  • You have at least 5+ years of hands-on technical working experience with Infoblox NIOS products, such as: DDI - DNS, DHCP & IP Address Management (IPAM).
  • You have at least 2 years of hands-on technical working experience with software-defined networking (SDN) technologies like Cisco® Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI™), VMware NSX® or similar.
  • You can demonstrate hands-on technical working experience in managing Public Cloud (Microsoft Azure & Google Cloud Platform preferred) environments, in a network related capacity.
  • You have hands-on technical working experience with Wired and Wireless 802.1x Network Authentication using Cisco® Identity Services Engine (ISE).
  • You have hands-on technical working experience with network automation scripting from Python, REST API endpoint.
  • You possess superior problem solving and decision-making skills to resolve work issues with the ability to work under pressure in a dynamic environment.
  • Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Engineering, Networking Technology or in a related field.


What's in it for you?

  • You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world.
  • We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success! We also foster an environment of innovation and continuous learning.
  • We care about our people, allowing them to design how they work to deliver amazing results.
  • We offer a competitive total rewards package, including a performance bonus, company matching programs (pension & Employee Share Ownership), generous vacation; health/medical/wellness benefits; employee banking privileges.
  • While we currently work remotely from home, when required to be onsite, our primary office in Scarborough is:
  • Renovated with a design focus on enabling collaboration through both environment and technology.
  • Furnished with an onsite cafeteria that serves hot foods, salads, sandwiches & snacks.
  • Equipped for breaks with table tennis, table soccer, pool table & TV’s. Our lounges have fridges, microwaves, complimentary hot beverage stations & water dispensers.
  • Minutes by TTC bus from Warden subway station on Line 2. Free employee shuttle service connecting the IT campus with nearby GO stations. 2023 opening of the Eglinton Crosstown Light Rail Transit with the Birchmount stop that’s steps away.
  • Minutes from the 401 & DVP. Free onsite & offsite employee parking with charging stations for electric vehicles onsite.


Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Scarborough

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Registered Physiotherapist (PT)
description:
Physiotherapist Position Available in Scarborough, Ontario.
We have an immediate position available for a Registered Physiotherapist. The position is part-time that can transition to full-time. Both experienced physiotherapists and new graduates are welcome to apply.
Friendly Rehab is a well-established private practice serving the Scarborough area for over 30 years. We are a busy, multidisciplinary, progressively thinking company with a modern approach to client care looking to hire the right physiotherapist to work alongside our team of health professionals.
We have developed a strong referral base with local medical and legal professionals and have an excellent relationship with insurers. We have a strong repeat client base and offer a friendly work environment with a strong emphasis on teamwork and client-centered care.
Our clients may present with a myriad of musculoskeletal injuries and a variety of post-operative care needs.
We have worked diligently towards putting all necessary safety precautions and protocols in place and minimize all unnecessary traffic within the clinic.

Roles include:
  • Performing clinical assessments, creating and implementing treatment plans for clients.
  • Providing ongoing evaluation and revision of client treatment programs.
  • Communicating with patients and coordinating with staff members.
  • Engaging in continuous learning and skills development.
  • Contributing to a positive patient experience.
  • Experience with MVA and WSIB cases is an asset.
  • Record keeping (SOAP notes).
  • Communicating with client referral sources.

Qualified candidates must:
  • Be licensed and in good standing with the College of Physiotherapy, Ontario Physiotherapy Association (or will soon be eligible) and have malpractice insurance.
  • Have current CPR certification.
  • Have excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Demonstrate effectiveness as an interdisciplinary team member.
  • Demonstrate problem-solving skills, good judgment and flexibility.
  • Be familiar will all modalities including: Shockwave Therapy, Decompression Table, Laser Therapy, Ultrasound, IFC/TENS.

We Offer:
  • A collaborative work environment with other health care professionals.
  • All administrative support and supplies.
  • Working in a clean environment, treatment rooms with plenty of natural light, kitchen for staff in place, fridge and microwave.
  • Bi-weekly payroll.
  • Free Parking.

Benefits:
  • Convenient TTC locations- Warden and Kennedy.
  • Compliance with the Ministry of Health Guidance regarding COVID19.

Please send resumes to : info@friendlyrehab.ca.

title: Project Manager (Traffic Signal Design)
description:
Company Description


We are a global architecture, engineering, planning, and technology firm defining the cities of tomorrow.

By connecting design and technology, we change how people experience their built environment. We work across disciplines to create the intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, and efficient infrastructure that shapes the way people live, move, learn, and heal.

With over 3,000 employees and 60+ offices around the world, we understand what it takes to work locally and scale globally.

At IBI, we’re defining the cities of tomorrow.


Job Description


Most of the things you'll work on:

  • Prepare Traffic Signal Design in urban environment.
  • Develop traffic signal and traffic control devices designs in Microstation, AutoCAD, and Civil 3D.
  • Direct, supervise, and mentor Microstation drafting technicians.
  • Design Experience in Temporary Traffic Control environment, functional roadway and intersection geometric, pavement marking and signage, AODA accessible path criteria, bicycle facilities, traffic signal system equipment, and roadway infrastructure dimensional relationship, and utility clearances.
  • Contribute significantly to and lead the successful design, production, coordination and management of Traffic signal design and consultancy projects.
  • Research into latest technology for traffic control devices, prepare technical reports, tender and contract documentation.
  • Conduct field support with respect to Traffic signal equipment and cabinet equipment setup and commissioning as may be required.
  • Communicate effectively with clients and internal team members (Engineers, Architects, Designers and Project Managers) in the design and specification development of Traffic Control Devices projects within an integrated multi-disciplinary project delivery team.
  • Ensure accuracy, completeness and quality of technical information and project documentation in accordance with QA/QC programs.
  • Ensure that engineering deliverables (e.g., drawings, specifications, analysis, budget estimates) comply with applicable regulations, standards, corporate procedures and sound engineering practices.
  • Initiate and work with drafting staff to complete engineering drawings
  • Liaise with clients, contractors, and the public.
  • Mentor and direct two to three designers or engineers.
  • Take directions from Associates or Associate Directors.
  • Client relationship building and management including but not limited to taking part in business development activities, proposal preparation, procuring staff resources, establishing project budgets and schedules, etc.
  • Prepare technical reports, tender documentation and field support (including commissioning/site inspection).
  • Ensure that project deliverables are met in a timely manner to a high quality including engineering stamped drawings and preparing final stamped reports.

Qualifications


You'll need to have:

  • University Degree or Diploma in Civil Engineering or Electrical Engineering focused on transportation and/or traffic engineering.
  • 12+ years’ relevant experience in traffic/transit engineering design and operations (in a consulting environment) with proven experience in Temporary Traffic Control Design and Inspection, Functional Roadway and Intersection design, Traffic Control System Commissioning, Temporary Staging, and Traffic Operations/Analysis.
  • Certification as a Professional Traffic Operations Engineer (PTOE)
  • Design and commissioning experience with BRT, LRT, and Rail signal priority and pre-emption system is preferred; ie: Traffic Control Devices Design and System commissioning; Previous experience in P3 linear Traffic Signal Design and/or Owner’s Engineers environment preferred.
  • Should have experience with local municipalities such as York Region, Waterloo Region, City of Toronto, London region and clients such as the MTO.
  • Experience with softwares such as Synchro / SimTraffic, HCS, and roundabout operations analysis applications, engineering software such as Microstation, AutoTurn, AutoCAD, Civil 3D design software is preferred.
  • Experience working in a multi-disciplinary team delivering various projects in complexity and size/scope
  • Strong interpersonal communications skills applicable both internally with project delivery staff as well as externally with project partners (clients, consultants, contractors and regulatory authorities)
  • Familiarity with Ontario Traffic Manuals, Highway Traffic Acts, Ontario Regulations, TAC, MUTCDC, City of Toronto engineering standard(s)/guidelines/regulations, MTO OPSS/OPSD, Canadian Electrical Code, Ontario Regulations 22/04 and associated pole-loading calculations, and OPSS Standards
  • Strong interpersonal communications skills applicable both internally with project delivery staff as well as externally with project partners (clients, consultants, contractors and regulatory authorities)
  • A valid, Class G, Ontario driver’s licence
  • Occasional travel is required.

Additional Information


We are currently in a work from home model during COVID-19, but when we do return to the office we're located on the 3rd floor of 8133 Warden Avenue, our Markham office in the Remington Corporate Centre is situated in the heart of Canada’s High-Tech Capital, Downtown Markham. This fast growing, master-planned community is immersed with public art, landscaped green space and a truly unique mix of amenities, seamlessly connected to public transit and major roadways. The neighbourhood is evolving into York Region’s premier hub of culture, education, commerce and entertainment. The office is in close proximity to the Markham Pan Am Centre, Unionville Go Station, and York University’s new Markham Centre campus opening in 2021. As one of IBI Group’s newest offices, the facility reflects the most up to date standards and design technology for an inviting and productive workspace, all to better serve clients of the region.

Our employees enjoy our small office feel and all the perks of a big office support system. You’ll have direct access to management while benefitting from our enthusiastic and helpful organizational resources team. The floors are open concept and creative and represent our collaborative approach to projects. As a global architecture, engineering and technology design firm, IBI Group also has offices across the country, continent and world.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record. Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada.

#LI-JP1

title: TRAFFIC COORDINATOR
description:
Toronto, ON

We are seeking a confident, dedicated, resourceful, and driven individual to join our team. If you are excited by the prospect of supporting a dynamic team in television media and playing a key role in representing Canada’s most influential multicultural media organization then this is the job for you!

The Traffic Coordinator will be responsible for checking and scheduling content to ensure a seamless broadcast of our TV channels.

Main Responsibilities
  • Work closely with management on system developments and workflow efficiencies
  • Work with programming and operations on program formats, sellable inventory and automation
  • Reconcile program logs for accurate billing and CRTC reporting
  • Process sales contracts and revisions into traffic system, monitoring and balancing inventory
  • Enter scheduling instructions for commercials received from advertising agencies or clients
  • Enter programming information and formats into traffic system
  • Prepare daily program logs for broadcast (create, edit, fill and time)
  • Perform program changes and associated contract pre-emptions & make goods
  • Call and distribute reports to sales
  • Perform other duties as required
Skills & Qualifications
  • 3-5 years experience at a television station in a traffic role
  • Traffic system experience is required; WideOrbit experience is an asset
  • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to find and implement unique and creative solutions
  • Data entry skills with expert computer skills including knowledge and competency with Microsoft Office 365 Suite
  • A high degree of accuracy, attention to detail and organization
  • Ability to work under the pressures of tight deadlines and multitask in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong initiative and self motivated, with ability to work both independently and on a team
  • Multilingual abilities would be a distinct advantage
TO APPLY

We thank all applicants for their interest, however only selected candidates will be contacted.

Please email your resume and cover letter tohr@tlnmediagroup.com.

With the following subject line: “Traffic Coordinator job application – NAME”

ABOUT TLN MEDIA GROUP: Canada’s most influential multicultural media company

www.tln.ca

Nearing 40 years of service to Canadians, the TLN Media Group organizationbrands continue to inform and entertain millions. Whether in Italian, Spanish, English and other languages, TLN has played a key role in the development of the national multicultural media landscape. Since launching in 1984, the original ethnic TV channel “Telelatino” has grown to become TLN Media Group, Canada’s most influential multicultural media company.TLN Media Group is an independent, immigrant-owned organization dedicated to connecting communities through storytelling and shared experiences.As a multicultural advocacy leader, TLN Media Group selects, curates, produces, and commissions unique and culturally significant TV and digital content distributed in Canada and worldwide. TLN TV, the original flagship channel has evolved into a mainstream-friendly destination providing multiculturally rich content. TLN Media Group also operates Canada’s most widely available multilingual TV channels led by Spanish language leader Univision Canada and top Italian language services Mediaset Italia Canada and TGCOM24 news network. And TLN Media Group’s additional TV channels include Canada’s first and only Heritage language channels for kids, Telebimbi (Italian) and Teleniños (Spanish), bringing well-known Canadian-made kids shows to families nationwide; and EuroWorld Sport TV, a channel dedicated to sports fandom.TLN Media Group has produced and promoted many cultural events and festivals, the most widely recognized of which is the annual TD Salsa in Toronto/Salsa on St Clair summer festival and street party.

title: Traffic Control Person/Flagger - Pipeline
description:
Description

Job Summary:

You are an experienced and enthusiastic Traffic Controller who and takes pride in safe and efficient flagging operation on the Pipeline sites.

Responsibilities
  • Directs trucks and equipment on and off site while maintaining safety of the area
  • Directs public traffic, including vehicles and pedestrians
  • Must be approachable, ethical, and accountable
  • May perform general labour duties as assigned
Requirements
  • Previous flagging experience working in BC
  • Must possess a valid Standardized Traffic Control Training certificate from the British Columbia Construction Safety Alliance (BCCSA)
  • Valid Ground Disturbance II and PSTS tickets are preferred
  • Must possess a valid class 5 driver's license
  • Must successfully complete pre-employment drug and alcohol testing
  • Able to incorporate health and safety concepts into work activities
Work Conditions
  • Modified 6/1 schedule equivalent to 3 weeks on, 1 week off
  • 12 hours days
  • Camp base accommodation
  • Will be required to work in outdoor conditio
Company Description

Additional Information:

Ledcor Pipeline offers a unique set of pipeline services unmatched anywhere in the oil and gas industry. From pipeline construction to investigative digs and subcontractor management, we are accustomed to operating in challenging terrain, and we maintain some of the largest pipeline networks in the world.

But when you work for Ledcor, your experience will go far beyond the project. Do you want a career that means more? Join our True Blue team now!

Employment Equity

At Ledcor we believe diversity, equity, and inclusion should be part of everything we do. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other identifying characteristic are encouraged to apply.

Our True Blue team consists of individuals from all backgrounds who contribute diverse perspectives and experiences to Ledcor. We are committed to continuing to build on our culture of empowerment, inclusion and belonging.

View our full Inclusion & Diversity statement here .

Date Posted

Apr 29, 2022

10355 152 Street, Surrey, BC, Canada

title: Traffic Control Person
description:
Dawson Road Maintenance // The Dawson Group is comprised of multiple companies serving British Columbia, including Dawson Construction and Dawson Civil, Dawson Road Maintenance, and IRL International Truck Centres & Idealease.

Dawson Road Maintenance Ltd. efficiently maintains public local roads, main highways, and bridges in accordance to the specifications set out by the Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure (MoTI). Utilizing highly trained personnel, innovative technologies and products, a diverse fleet of specialized maintenance equipment, and real time weather forecasting; Dawson Road Maintenance works hard to continuously apply maintenance where and when it is needed. We provide these services to ensure British Columbians are safely connected, every day.

In this role you will be a valued member of Dawson Road Maintenance, working as a temporary, full-time, Traffic Control Person, reporting to: Road Foreman. To be considered for this role, you should have good knowledge of safety around equipment, an eagerness to learn, and a strong work ethic. If you are looking to join a growing organization to build your career with, apply today. Your base location will be Williams Lake, BC.

What Success Looks Like
  • Prioritize safety of yourself and your team in all aspects of the job
  • Conduct pre-shift inspections and report any concerns or malfunctions to supervisors
  • Learn and follow safety regulations
  • Perform all necessary work while complying with all company policies and procedures
  • Stop, slow, and safely direct traffic through work or construction sites
  • Protect workers in the construction zone by regulating traffic flow
  • Give traffic control directions and signals clearly and precisely so that motorists understand their meaning
  • Keep the flow of traffic moving with as few delays as possible
What You Bring
  • Flagging experience and BCCSA Traffic Control Ticket is an asset
  • Valid Driver’s License
  • Be available for on call work
Benefits

Looking to be part of a well-established family-owned company? Our core values include: People First, Integrity, Respect and Excellence and as such we are committed to providing an environment that supports the growth and effectiveness of our employees and the organization. You will work for a company that offers an excellent compensation package, pension, and medical benefits, as well as learning and long-term advancement opportunities.

The Dawson Group is expanding, and we need people like you to join us on our journey to help us continue safely connecting our communities.

Apply now to start the conversation!

The Dawson Group uses a centralized application service- please apply electronically as paper resumes will not be accepted

title: Traffic Painter I - REPOST
description:
Requisition ID: 35515

Company

Located on the traditional, ancestral and unceded lands of the xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam), Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), and səlilwətaɬ (Tsleil-Waututh), Vancouver has a commitment to becoming a City of Reconciliation. Vancouver consistently ranks as one of the world’s most liveable cities and is working towards being the greenest city in the world. Named among Canada's Top 100 Employers, BC's Top Employers, and Canada's Greenest Employers, the City of Vancouver seeks colleagues who can help shape and embody our core commitments to sustainability, decolonization, equity and outstanding quality of life for all residents.

Consider joining our committed team of staff and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.

Main Purpose and Function

The Traffic Painter I engages in semi-skilled traffic maintenance work, which includes painting crosswalks, safety zones, and other road markings, as well as installing and replacing traffic signs, posts and barricades

The position reports to the Superintendent I of Traffic Operations and is directly supervised by a Traffic Operations Supervisor, Crew Lead, or Charge Hand.

Specific Duties And Responsibilities

The Traffic Painter I is responsible for using various types of equipment in sign maintenance and road marking, as well as answering and dealing with a variety of public inquiries while working at various City locations and jobs sites. Other duties include ordering replacement signs and road marking materials; completing daily paper work requirements; and performing related duties as required

The hours of work are: 7:00am to 3:30pm or 11:00pm to 7:30am, Monday to Friday. The position will be required to work a 40 hour work schedule. Shift differential may apply.

Functional and or physical assessment related to the bona fide position requirements may be required.

Qualifications

Education and Experience:
  • Completion of Grade 10
  • Recent related experience with traffic sign installation and road marking is preferred
  • Traffic control experience is an asset
  • Previous education and training in WHMIS is an asset
Knowledge, Skills And Abilities
  • Knowledge of safe work practices, methods, tools, materials and equipment used in traffic maintenance work.
  • Some knowledge of Canadian and departmental standards governing the type and location of crosswalks, other related road markings and signs.
  • Knowledge of safe work procedures.
  • Working knowledge of Vancouver’s Street and Traffic By-Laws and the Vancouver street system is an asset.
  • Sufficient physical strength, stamina and coordination to perform heavy physical labour.
  • Ability to work outside in all weather conditions, and on uneven surfaces.
  • Ability to use a variety of tools and equipment related to the work.
  • Ability to lift, push and pull heavy objects.
  • Ability to walk or stand continuously with frequent bending or twisting.
  • Ability to safely work close to moving machinery and in high traffic areas.
  • Ability to work on ladders, elevated areas and on uneven surfaces.
  • Ability to understand and carry out oral/written instructions.
  • Ability to read and interpret drawings for the lay-out of road markings, traffic control and sign installations is an asset.
  • Ability to recognize the hazards involved in working amidst traffic and take necessary precautionary measures.
  • Ability to drive a light service truck when required.
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills and the ability to deal tactfully and effectively with staff and the public are essential.
  • Good reflexes and a high degree of mental alertness.
Driver’s License And Record Checks
  • A current and valid Class 5 BC Driver’s License or higher and a safe driving record are required.
  • The license must not include any restrictions that would affect the ability to legally and safely carry out job responsibilities.
To be considered for the position, applicants must attach copies of their Commercial Driving Records Abstract (N Print) and Insurance & Claims history record for the past 5 years for review.

All City of Vancouver employees are required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of hire and ongoing employment. Candidates may only be exempted from this requirement if they request and are approved for an accommodation based on a reason related to a Human Rights Code ground (such as disability). Such a request must be made during, not after, the recruitment process.

Business Unit/Department: Engineering Services (1300)

Affiliation: CUPE 15 Non Pks

Employment Type: Temporary Full Time

Position Start Date: April 2022

Position End Date: October 2022

Salary Information: Pay Grade GR-015: $26.87 to $31.56 per hour

Positions Available: Multiple Positions

Application Close: May 6, 2022

At the City of Vancouver, we are committed to recruiting a diverse workforce that represents the community we so proudly serve. Indigenous applicants, people of colour, all genders, LGBT2Q+ and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Accommodations will be provided upon request during the selection process. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion.

Before you click Apply now

Once you start your application you can save your work and leave the applications page, however please remember to submit your profile to the specific job requisition before the posting closing date.

In addition to uploading your cover letter and resume, part of the application process may include answering application questions related to the preferred requirements of the role which may take approx.. 5-10mins. Cover letters should express interest and highlight additional information relevant to the position and resumes should include a tailored summary of skills and experience related to the position.

title: Transportation Operator
description:
Join Vale today. Continuously learn throughout your career.

Welcome to Vale in Canada. As a leader in the mining industry, our responsibility is to positively impact our people, communities and the environment. We value our workforce and offer continuous training and career development opportunities for our people.

Vale is a global leader in the production of iron ore and one of the largest producers of nickel. Active in Canada for over 100 years, Vale employs nearly 6,000 people across our corporate office in Toronto and sites in Manitoba, Ontario, Newfoundland and Labrador. Applying the latest technologies to sustainably produce nickel, copper, cobalt, platinum group metals, gold and silver is at the heart of what we do.

With our global headquarters in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, and approximately 125,000 employees in over 30 countries, Vale is constantly growing and changing. We invite you to be part of our evolution.

Our Sudbury Operations have been in existence for more than 100 years. With five mines, a mill, a smelter, a refinery and nearly 4,000 employees it is also one of the largest integrated mining complexes in the world. Sudbury is also home to several administrative sites serving both the Ontario Operations as well as all our North Atlantic Operations.

About You

The ideal candidate will possess:
  • A grade 12 level education or GED equivalency
  • A valid driver’s (G) license is required; a D license with a Z endorsement is an asset
  • 1 to 5 years’ industrial work experience with a demonstrated safe work record
  • Previous railway (train and/or track) experience an asset
  • Heavy equipment (loaders, excavator, rock truck) operating experience is an asset
Requirements And Accountabilities
  • Operate or direct movement of diesel locomotive, rolling stock, ballast regulator and other hi-rail vehicles on standard gauge track, includes pre-use checks, brake tests, minor repairs such as replacing hose bags and gaskets, tightening airlines and fittings, maintaining sand and fuel supply
  • Line manual switches, observe switch settings and points. Couple and uncouple cars, locomotives and hose bags
  • Maintain and repair track and switches, including cleaning, replacement, snow removal
  • Operate mobile equipment to load, unload, transport and position heavy equipment, materials, supplies and personnel around and between plant properties, to and from trucks, railroad cars, warehouses, stockpiles, and other work areas
  • Operate front end loader to distribute, blend and load material into railway cars and trucks.
  • Complete written pre-operation checks on all equipment, provide an end of shift report of work completed
  • Perform work in accordance with Transportation Department handbook of rules and special instructions
  • Must be able to pass the required examinations, read and understand safety instructions, books of rules, instructions and regulations, timetables, bulletins, waybills, placards, and other written or printed material
  • Must be prepared to work weekends and shifts up to 12 hours including holidays, weekends, days and nights.
  • Must be prepared to work outdoors in adverse weather conditions
What We Offer You

The Transportation Operator position will allow the right candidate to shape our refinery operations. Additionally, Vale Canada offers a series of benefits including:
  • Competitive salary
  • Participation in our Employee Family Assistance Program
  • Online leadership training opportunities
  • Opportunities to advise and oversee the design, budget and construction of new mines and expansions
Difference Makes All the Difference

At Vale, we are committed to ensuring an inclusive work environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. Vale encourages everyone to express their ideas and opinions and Vale values the plurality of individual profiles. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome – they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or any other personal consideration that makes us different.

Vale is an equal opportunity employer seeking to increase diversity across its operations and improve equal opportunity at Vale and in the mining industry.

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, accommodation is available throughout our recruitment process for applicants with disabilities.

Apply

Interested applicants are encouraged to submit their application online at www.valejobs.ca or by clicking Apply below.

We appreciate your interest in being a part of the team though only those applicants who are selected for interviews will be contacted.

Comments
  • Please provide detailed employment history and detailed description of previous experience.
  • If you have completed government training modules, please attach a copy of your official Ministry of Training, Colleges and Universities (MTCU) transcript, when you apply.

title: Traffic Coordinator - Digital Signage
description:
Job Description

The Traffic Coordinator is to accurately schedule contracted media and content to digital signage networks, following Cineplex company policies and protocols. The role supports digital sales growth as well as network monitoring to effectively troubleshoot any network issues along with the internal CDM Helpdesk.
  • This role will require weekend support, Wednesday to Sunday during business hours (9am-5pm)
  • Schedule creative and content and log flight details using available software and tools to ensure accurate execution of all campaigns for our digital signage networks.
  • Coordinate with external vendor to accommodate all requested photos and provide post campaign analytics and Proof of Performance as requested. Working with reports from various sources, extract and summarize crucial data and in a simplified and meaningful way to help monitor the network. Keep the team and stakeholders informed of any network issues or updates. Troubleshoot any issues with Helpdesk.
  • Working closely with affiliated networks, ensure that all creatives are approved as per each property’s guidelines. Keep the team and stakeholders informed of any challenges.
  • Liaise with clients to acquire creative and screen to ensure it meets specs, does not provide a network conflict of interest, and is approved by the network’s assigned representative prior to airing to the public.

Qualifications
  • Post-Secondary Education with Degree or Diploma in Digital Media, Marketing, Commerce, Statistic, Web Development, Information Technology or relevant field Preferred.
  • 1-3 years in advertising media, digital media or agency experience.
  • 1-3 years of office administration, data entry or customer service experience.
  • Exceptional relationship management and communication skills (written and verbal).
  • Self-starting team player with high attention to detail, drive to innovate and problem solve.
  • Superior computer skills, proficiency in MS-Word and MS-Excel required.

Additional Information

Inclusion & Diversity:

Cineplex Media is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We encourage and welcome applications from all intersectional walks of life. The collective sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, innovation, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talent represents a significant part of our culture. By valuing a diverse workforce, we enforce hiring practices that are fair and equitable.

Accessibility

Cineplex Media is committed to improving access and opportunities for all individuals, including those with disabilities by identifying and removing barriers that may prevent, inhibit or restrict their access to employment opportunities. If you require accommodation at any stage of our hiring process (application, interviews, assessments, and placement), please contact us at 416-323-6600 or via email at jobs@cineplex.com.Interested applicants, please apply today.

While we appreciate all interest, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. As part of Scene+ standard recruitment process, suitable candidate(s) will be required to undergo pre-employment screening as a condition of employment or promotion.

No Agency Calls Please

title: Traffic Operations System (TOC) Operator
description:
Company Description

We are a global architecture, engineering, planning, and technology firm defining the cities of tomorrow.

By connecting design and technology, we change how people experience their built environment. We work across disciplines to create the intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, and efficient infrastructure that shapes the way people live, move, learn, and heal.

With over 3,000 employees and 60+ offices around the world, we understand what it takes to work locally and scale globally.

At IBI, we’re defining the cities of tomorrow.

Job Description

IBI Group currently has outstanding opportunities for passionate and professional individuals looking to begin an exciting career in Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS).

We currently have full-time, part-time, and casual openings for Traffic Operations Centre (TOC) Operators at the City of Toronto Traffic Operations Centre.

The City of Toronto TOC is located at 703 Don Mills Rd North York, ON

The work involves operating a variety of Intelligent Transportation System (ITS) devices and information systems on a multi-monitor computer workstation to monitor roadways for ongoing traffic incidents along with dispatching and coordinating with First Responders, disseminating traveller information and database entry.

The Toronto TOC operates 24/7/365, which involves multiple shift times and holiday workdays are required. Starting pay is $19 hr.

Qualifications

The ideal candidate will have specialized experience and subject matter knowledge of the following though no prior TOC / ITS work experience is required.
  • High school or GED Diploma
  • Candidate must have in-depth experience with Windows PCs and proficient in the use of a multi-monitor computer workstation with the ability to quickly enter and manage a real-time data entry database.
  • In-depth knowledge of the Toronto geography and roadway network.
  • Skills in interpersonal relationships and ability to work well within a diverse group.
  • Ability to clearly communicate information over a radio system or network.
  • Ability and skillset to use freeway management and other traffic control computer application and technologies such as cameras, variable message signs, sensors, and control devices.
  • Be self-motivated with the use of these systems to maintain a situational awareness on the City's entire road network.
  • Previous experience writing reports, and correspondence considered an asset.
  • Ability to coordinate real time activities and priorities.
  • Capability to take calls, dispatch on a radio or telephone and otherwise communicate in a clear and concise manner.
  • Good organization skills to monitor several systems and events simultaneously.
  • Good communications skills to perform tasks such as dispatching City staff and contracted crews for routine and emergency road traffic maintenance activities.
  • Ability to use sound judgement while collecting, reviewing, validating, and disseminating road restriction/closure information to the public and always communicate professionally.
  • In-depth knowledge of Toronto geography and highway system.
  • Candidate must be able to pass a stringent background check and be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as per IBI and City of Toronto guidelines.

Additional Information

IBI Group provides a competitive benefit package and pays association dues and licensing fees.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record. Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada.

title: Traffic Technician, Union Position
description:
Help ensure the safety of construction workers and users of the roadway in Ontario.

Direct Traffic Management is a traffic protection specialist with facilities in Hamilton and Mississauga, providing traffic control services to construction companies and engineering firms across Ontario.

Direct Traffic Management has a reputation for delivering excellent service and meeting the highest standards for job performance and project safety. Direct Traffic Management staff are highly trained, professional and courteous. Direct Traffic Management is proud to be a leader in the traffic services industry.

Direct Traffic Management Offers

$19.46 per hour pay rate to start

$20.46 per hour pay rate after 90 days of employment

Join the union after 90 days of employment

Lots of hours available for trained and qualified staff including paid overtime

Paid weekly

Flexibility to work days, evenings or nights

Great employer paid benefits

Employer sponsored pension program

Gain experience in the Construction industry

Work outdoors

Opportunities for advancement

Minimum Requirements

Grade 12 or equivalent

Valid class G driver's license with a clean abstract

Ability to drive a variety of vehicles

Communicate comfortably in English - Both spoken and written

Ability to lift 50 pounds

Accessible at all times via telephone and text message for scheduling and work assignment

 

Duties And Responsibilities

Under the supervision of a Direct Traffic Management Team Lead, read and understand traffic control plans, and follow verbal work instructions as provided

Perform the set-up and take-down of roadway lane closures

Control traffic flow in construction areas

Securely load and unload traffic control equipment and signage delivered to job sites

Sign installation

Paperwork including vehicle inspections reports 

Working Conditions

Work outdoors and in a variety of weather conditions

Periods of standing or sitting during the roadway closure

Hours of work and work assignments may vary for operational reasons

Traffic management services may be delivered seven days a week and 24 hours a day during the busy season

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

The above statement reflects the general details considered necessary to describe the principle functions of the job identified and shall not be considered as the detailed description of all work required in the job.

title: (Canada) Evening Data Entry (Remote)
description:
Remote work from home administrative assistant, data entry clerk, typing, customer service representative, get started now.

Thank you for checking us out! Work From Home Data Entry Jobs - Part-time, Full-time

We are seeking individuals who are looking for part time or full-time work or side gigs to be connected with companies that are hiring employees directly to work from their homes. You will find both full-time and also part-time remote opportunities in a variety of career fields.

Legitimate Work From Home Data Entry Jobs are going to require that you have skills appropriate to the position you are looking for. Training is given based upon the position.

Job Requirements
  • Computer with net access
  • Silent work space away from distractions
  • Should be able as well as comfortable to working in an environment without immediate supervision
  • Capacity to read, comprehend, and follow oral and also written instructions.
  • Data entry or administrative assistant experience is not needed but can be a bonus
  • We are hiring those who have a history in health care, storage facility worker, delivery drivers, customer service, etc - we invite all backgrounds as long as you're ready to learn
You should apply on our website only.

Job Needs
  • Typing 25+ words per min
  • You enjoy data entry work as well as can do the work from your home or location of choosing (remote work at home job)
  • Computer with net access
  • It is critical that you be self-motivated and able to follow explicit instructions to start working from home
  • Self Motivated - you must be 100% able to commit to collaborating with little supervision
  • Work from home jobs of this nature need Web and one of the following: Laptop or PC, MAC, or Smart Device - Android or IOS
Ready to get going? Start today as well as earn money next week.

Thanks for checking us out and we look forward to helping you attain your goals!

title: Transportation Worker - 82079
description:
About The Ottawa Hospital

Inspired by research and driven by compassion!

The Ottawa Hospital (TOH) is one of Canada’s largest learning and research multi-campus hospitals. With more than 1,100 beds and approximately 12,000 staff members, we deliver specialized care to the Eastern Ontario region.

From the compassion of our people to the relentless pursuit of new discoveries, The Ottawa Hospital never stops seeking solutions to the most complex health-care challenges while continually engaging with the community to support our vision for better patient care.

Working together with its research institute, the University of Ottawa, and other partners, the hospital is continually gaining national and international recognition for high-quality patient care, teaching and research, while striving to meet the needs of the culturally diverse community we serve.

Position Information

Transportation Workers in the Logistical Services Department are responsible for the transportation of patients, specimens, supplies, linens, medications, rolling stock, equipment, furniture, mail, patient information, food, and other items throughout the campus in a timely, efficient and courteous manner. As a Transportation Worker, you would be in direct contact with patients and clinical teams, supporting the world-class care provided at The Ottawa Hospital.

Minimum availability requirements: 2/3 weekends, 8 weeks during the period from June 1 to September 30, and five shifts between December 23 and January 3, inclusive of either Christmas Day, Boxing Day or December 31 / New Year's Day.

Rotation/Shifts

Position may be located at either the Civic, General, Riverside Campus or other TOH Satellite locations

Rotation - Various Shifts.

What you will do
  • Perform routine deliveries as scheduled and responding to requests when requested or paged;
  • Transport patients;
  • Transport specimens, medication, and other items as required;
  • Logging all activities according to procedures;
  • Loading and unloading supplies.
Basic Requirements
  • Grade 12 or equivalent (i.e. G.E.D. test);
  • Be able to work on your feet for long periods of time;
  • Eligible to work in Canada.
What you can expect from us

The Ottawa Hospital is committed to providing a healthy, safe, and inclusive work environment for everyone. We are driven by our purpose to provide each patient with the world-class care, exceptional service and compassion we would want for our loved ones.

We offer an attractive and equitable compensation package including a comprehensive benefits package, a Defined Benefit Pension (DBP) plan, and insurance protection. We also offer discounts from choice providers on a variety of products and services.

The Ottawa Hospital provides various Health and Wellness resources as well as opportunities for personal and professional development opportunities from our in-house Learning and Leadership Development team to help align your goals with your career objectives.

Interested? Apply today!

If you are passionate about what you do, motivated by improving the health of the community, excited by leading-edge medical technology, and as committed to excellence, quality and patient safety as we are, we would like to hear from you. Please submit an on-line application for the position you are interested in. We thank all those who apply but only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

The Ottawa Hospital is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, accommodations due to a disability are available throughout the recruitment process.
skills: ['Be able to work on your feet for long periods of time;', 'Logging all activities according to procedures;', 'Perform routine deliveries as scheduled and responding to requests when requested or paged;']

title: Traffic Control Person
description:
Dawson Road Maintenance // The Dawson Group is comprised of multiple companies serving British Columbia, including Dawson Construction and Dawson Civil, Dawson Road Maintenance, and IRL International Truck Centres & Idealease.

Dawson Road Maintenance Ltd. efficiently maintains public local roads, main highways, and bridges in accordance to the specifications set out by the Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure (MoTI). Utilizing highly trained personnel, innovative technologies and products, a diverse fleet of specialized maintenance equipment, and real time weather forecasting; Dawson Road Maintenance works hard to continuously apply maintenance where and when it is needed. We provide these services to ensure British Columbians are safely connected, every day.

In this role you will be a valued member of Dawson Road Maintenance, working as a temporary, full-time, Traffic Control Person, reporting to: Road Foreman. To be considered for this role, you should have good knowledge of safety around equipment, an eagerness to learn, and a strong work ethic. If you are looking to join a growing organization to build your career with, apply today. Your base location will be 100 Mile House, BC.

What Success Looks Like
  • Prioritize safety of yourself and your team in all aspects of the job
  • Conduct pre-shift inspections and report any concerns or malfunctions to supervisors
  • Learn and follow safety regulations
  • Perform all necessary work while complying with all company policies and procedures
  • Stop, slow, and safely direct traffic through work or construction sites
  • Protect workers in the construction zone by regulating traffic flow
  • Give traffic control directions and signals clearly and precisely so that motorists understand their meaning
  • Keep the flow of traffic moving with as few delays as possible
What You Bring
  • Flagging experience and BCCSA Traffic Control Ticket is an asset
  • Valid Driver’s License
  • Be available for on call work
Benefits

Looking to be part of a well-established family-owned company? Our core values include: People First, Integrity, Respect and Excellence and as such we are committed to providing an environment that supports the growth and effectiveness of our employees and the organization. You will work for a company that offers an excellent compensation package, pension, and medical benefits, as well as learning and long-term advancement opportunities.

The Dawson Group is expanding, and we need people like you to join us on our journey to help us continue safely connecting our communities.

Apply now to start the conversation!

The Dawson Group uses a centralized application service- please apply electronically as paper resumes will not be accepted

Paperwork including vehicle inspections reports 

Working Conditions

Work outdoors and in a variety of weather conditions

Periods of standing or sitting during the roadway closure

Hours of work and work assignments may vary for operational reasons

Traffic management services may be delivered seven days a week and 24 hours a day during the busy season

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

The above statement reflects the general details considered necessary to describe the principle functions of the job identified and shall not be considered as the detailed description of all work required in the job.

title: Traffic Coordinator - Digital Signage
description:
The Traffic Coordinator is to accurately schedule contracted media and content to digital signage networks, following Cineplex company policies and protocols. The role supports digital sales growth as well as network monitoring to effectively troubleshoot any network issues along with the internal CDM Helpdesk.

  • This role will require weekend support, Wednesday to Sunday during business hours (9am-5pm)
  • Schedule creative and content and log flight details using available software and tools to ensure accurate execution of all campaigns for our digital signage networks.
  • Coordinate with external vendor to accommodate all requested photos and provide post campaign analytics and Proof of Performance as requested.  Working with reports from various sources, extract and summarize crucial data and in a simplified and meaningful way to help monitor the network.  Keep the team and stakeholders informed of any network issues or updates. Troubleshoot any issues with Helpdesk.
  • Working closely with affiliated networks, ensure that all creatives are approved as per each property’s guidelines.  Keep the team and stakeholders informed of any challenges.
  • Liaise with clients to acquire creative and screen to ensure it meets specs, does not provide a network conflict of interest, and is approved by the network’s assigned representative prior to airing to the public.

Qualifications

  • Post-Secondary Education with Degree or Diploma in Digital Media, Marketing, Commerce, Statistic, Web Development, Information Technology or relevant field Preferred.
  • 1-3 years in advertising media, digital media or agency experience.
  • 1-3 years of office administration, data entry or customer service experience.
  • Exceptional relationship management and communication skills (written and verbal).
  • Self-starting team player with high attention to detail, drive to innovate and problem solve.
  • Superior computer skills, proficiency in MS-Word and MS-Excel required.

Additional Information

Inclusion & Diversity:

Cineplex Media  is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We encourage and welcome applications from all intersectional walks of life. The collective sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, innovation, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talent represents a significant part of our culture. By valuing a diverse workforce, we enforce hiring practices that are fair and equitable. 

Accessibility

Cineplex Media  is committed to improving access and opportunities for all individuals, including those with disabilities by identifying and removing barriers that may prevent, inhibit or restrict their access to employment opportunities. If you require accommodation at any stage of our hiring process (application, interviews, assessments, and placement), please contact us at 416-323-6600 or via email at jobs@cineplex.com.Interested applicants, please apply today.

While we appreciate all interest, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. As part of Scene+  standard recruitment process, suitable candidate(s) will be required to undergo pre-employment screening as a condition of employment or promotion.

No Agency Calls Please

title: Global Traffic Specialist
description:
About The Opportunity

This is a Traffic Specialist role, working within the Global Brand Team. This role requires project management skills - which include managing client expectations and timelines in a NA time zone primarily, as well as managing projects/handover to the Global Traffic Manager for the next business day. In addition to this, supporting the firm globally will require some flexibility with working hours.

Responsibilities
  • Manage input of creative requests, using process set by Traffic Manager, for regional/global team into cloud-based intake platform
  • Alert Traffic Manager and Senior team members to urgent tasks/requests and manage solution accordingly
  • Work with CMMC team members to ensure clear creative briefs are captured onto cloud-based system
  • Using process set by Traffic Manager, manages the transition of work across time zones to meet deadlines
  • Prioritises workload and assigns projects accordingly, using independent discretion and judgement, to ensure delivery deadlines are met
  • Responsible for supporting Senior Designers and Global Design Managers to manage tasks related to ensuring successful overall job flow
  • Must have superior organizational skills and keen attention to detail; be able to take ownership of tasks, demonstrate follow-through, and be hungry for opportunities to learn and grow
  • Ability to work late into the evenings and must be flexible with scheduling
  • Professional demeanor appropriate for a global law firm and/or corporate environment is required
  • Manage project calendars and scheduling internal design meetings with clients and vendors
  • Organizes and maintains department-wide resources such as design supplies and software, vendor list and asset library
  • Support Senior Designers on projects
  • Manage print processes either in house via the print room or external providers
  • Acts as brand ambassador across all channels

Communication
  • Develops relationships with partners, other fee earners and support departments to ensure smooth delivery of creative initiatives
  • Can-do attitude in order to meet competing deadlines and manage expectations of those under pressure

Requirements

Competencies:
  • Experience of working within a corporate environment in a marketing, communications or corporate agency
  • Understands creative briefing and has ability to clean briefs
  • Project management experience
  • Brand/visual identity process knowledge
  • Ability to take direction, ownership and process multiple ongoing projects
  • Ability to make decisions on own initiative

Essential attributes
  • Advanced communication skills in English
  • Experience of project management and intake process useful
  • Current knowledge of Microsoft Office software
  • Ability to liaise with senior managers across the Firm
  • Must be willing to do basic admin required for the role
  • Experience of working with external service providers
  • A confident, supportive approach to team working
  • Able to quickly establish good working relationships and promote best practice across all offices and at all levels
  • Highly organised in order to successfully manage a varied and heavy workload
  • Must be able to work on multiple projects ensuring all deadlines are met and to communicate when this is not possible
  • Excellent attention to detail with methodical approach to work, with a strong focus on accuracy and an understanding of the need for documentation and well-defined procedures
  • Polite and confident in manner and ability to exercise tact and diplomacy in an organizational setting
  • Shows resilience to overcome obstacles to deliver what is required
  • Carries out all responsibilities in a way which supports the practice’s values and promotes its equal opportunities and diversity principles
  • Ability to be an ambassador for Dentons, being professional in outlook, attitude and appearance
  • A passion for all things brand

Benefits

Diversity & Inclusion

Essential to our success as a global law firm is our ability to attract and retain the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We want a work environment where everyone can reach their potential and we have an inclusive culture which respects individual differences.

We undertake and support a number of internal and external initiatives aimed at increasing diversity within the profession and we encourage all our partners and staff to get involved.

Equal Opportunities

Dentons is committed to providing equal opportunities for all.

Reward and Recognition

Remuneration and befits package will reflect the successful candidates experience and country where hired

title: (Canada) Online Writing Jobs
description:
Entry-level job - Work From Home. Full or part-time positions available from home. With or without experience we urge all candidates to apply.

We are seeking candidates curious about dealing with companies that are hiring staff members for remote at home positions. Both full time and part-time opportunities are offered in a range of job fields including but not limited to data entry, advertising and marketing, client service as well as support, clerical, and administrative. Prospects with experience in within sales, outside sales, and also retail sales are likewise motivated to apply on our web site. If you can work on your own from home and also are self-motivated you would be a wonderful fit. Ideal candidates should enjoy such work as email customer support, information entry, social networks posting and also assessing products. Data entry clerks originate from all various backgrounds consisting of customer support, sales support, clerical, secretary, administrative assistant, receptionist, call center, part-time, retail fields & more We are looking to hear from you. Please apply on our internet site today!

Requirements

Computer with net access

Peaceful working area away from disturbances

Desire to take instructions

title: Traffic Control
description:
Reporting to the Foreman, the Traffic Control will be responsible for all general flagger duties required on commercial projects. They will ensure work tasks are performed safely in accordance with Occupational Health and Safety Legislation and company policies and that work is performed with a high level of quality and timeliness.

This position is based in the Vancouver, BC area on a client site.

Working Conditions
  • Shift schedule: Monday-Friday, 7:00am-3:30pm
  • Working around heavy equipment
  • Hazard awareness
  • Work both indoors and outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Personal safety equipment will be required, e.g. steel-toed safety boots, safety glasses/goggles, etc.
Responsibilities
  • Responsible for the set-up, maintenance, and takedown of traffic signage.
  • Responsible for the safe and courteous movement of vehicles and personnel at the assigned job site.
  • Follow instructions from crew lead hand and foreman.
  • Review and participate in the preparation of safe work practices/procedures as required.
  • Other tasks and labour duties as required on the jobsite.
Qualifications
  • High school diploma
  • 1 year experience as a Flagger in the construction industry
  • TCP Flagger certification required
  • CSTS
  • WHIMIS
  • Ability to take direction and follow through on instructions
  • General construction safety knowledge
  • Committed dedication to safety; reflected in practice and experience
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Positive attitude towards safety
  • Ability to work collaboratively
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills
  • Superior focus on customer satisfaction
  • Pre-Employment Drug and Alcohol testing required
Physical Requirements
  • Stand or walk for long periods of time
  • Ability to stand, crouch, and kneel for long periods of time
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.
  • Climbing stairs/ladders regularly
  • Exposure to hazards such as heights, power tools, slips, falls, falling objects, and sharp hand tools
Compensation And Benefits
  • Overtime is compensated per the collective agreement
About Us

Safety, sustainability, collaboration, and integrity are core company values that encourage innovation and make a lasting difference in meeting the goals of our stakeholders and the communities in which we operate. We strongly support and encourage employees to get involved and give back in their local communities. We expect our employees to bring their best to work every day and in return, management recognizes and rewards employees for their valued contribution through competitive compensation, robust benefits, health and wellness programs, and learning development opportunities.

Who We Are?

We have proudly served the Canadian construction industry for over 100 years. Our rich history demonstrates our reach and diversity as an integrated, full-service organization serving the commercial and industrial markets. We deliver confidence through a client-centered approach that ensures the highest quality of service, reduces risk, and delivers results.

We provide a comprehensive range of construction services from new construction for industrial, commercial, and institutional markets; to industrial maintenance, repair and operations services, heavy civil construction, and contract surface mining; as well as vertical infrastructure including, electrical, mechanical, and specialty trades. For over 100 years, we have been a people-focused company with an unwavering commitment to safety and a high level of service that provides long-term value for all stakeholders.

Only candidates being considered for an interview will be contacted directly.

Unsolicited resumes and phone inquiries from 3rd party agencies will not be accepted.
